job_description: hear.com is the fastest growing hearing aid company in the world. We believe that everyone should hear well to live well. With our unique digitalized business model, we've changed the way hearing aids are delivered. Every day our team helps customers improve their quality of life through better hearing - since the start in 2012 that’s over 200,000 clients. We work hard, and we also have a lot of fun and exceptional times, in our 11 international offices, from Denver to Seoul. We sell the world’s best hearing devices – as simple as that. What started as a small dream in an apartment in Berlin, Germany, in 2012 has grown into a global phenomenon with over 1,000 team members! We operate in 11 countries and are the online No 1 in each one of them – making us the world leader in online hearing care. Why hear.com? · A global company with a long term vision and strong growth · Warm Leads, No Cold Calling · $33,000 base salary + uncapped high commission · Work from Home Office (Remote) · Comprehensive Virtual Training · Full Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits and option for 401K During a typical day, you will... · Provide our customers with detailed phone consultations · Develop individual solutions based on the hearing needs of our customer · Provide knowledge and in-depth advice for hearing loss and hearing aids · Schedule appointments with customers and our partner providers. · Support our customers during their 45 day trial until they are 100% happy with their devices You are... · A driven sales professional with a proven track record of success · Emotionally intelligent and communicate with empathy · Have tons of energy, compassion, humor, and enthusiasm You have… · Strong sales skills over the phone · Powerful work ethics and a Growth Mindset · A college degree · Over the phone sales experience Job Type: Full-time Pay: $50,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Weekends Supplemental Pay: Commission pay Experience: Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)
html_job_description:
hear.com is the fastest growing hearing aid company in the world. We believe that everyone should hear well to live well. With our unique digitalized business model, we've changed the way hearing aids are delivered. Every day our team helps customers improve their quality of life through better hearing - since the start in 2012 that’s over 200,000 clients. We work hard, and we also have a lot of fun and exceptional times, in our 11 international offices, from Denver to Seoul.

We sell the world’s best hearing devices – as simple as that. What started as a small dream in an apartment in Berlin, Germany, in 2012 has grown into a global phenomenon with over 1,000 team members! We operate in 11 countries and are the online No 1 in each one of them – making us the world leader in online hearing care.

Why hear.com?

· A global company with a long term vision and strong growth

· Warm Leads, No Cold Calling

· $33,000 base salary + uncapped high commission

· Work from Home Office (Remote)

· Comprehensive Virtual Training

· Full Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits and option for 401K

During a typical day, you will...

· Provide our customers with detailed phone consultations

· Develop individual solutions based on the hearing needs of our customer

· Provide knowledge and in-depth advice for hearing loss and hearing aids

· Schedule appointments with customers and our partner providers.

· Support our customers during their 45 day trial until they are 100% happy with their devices

You are...

· A driven sales professional with a proven track record of success

· Emotionally intelligent and communicate with empathy

· Have tons of energy, compassion, humor, and enthusiasm

You have…

· Strong sales skills over the phone

· Powerful work ethics and a Growth Mindset

· A college degree

· Over the phone sales experience

job_description: Hybrid Mode Workstream - ERP IMPLEMENTATION SPECIALIST Support AME Digital Procurement Solution Team for implementation of the SaaS (Zycus) solution User Interface Fields Identification & mapping of fields needed for Hybrid Mode (ERP to SaaS Solution) Creation/Modification/Deactivation/Holds; working closely to validate with local impacted teams and BIS counterpart. Assist with populating needed templates (IE UI configuration, workflow, etc…). Process & Change Management Partner with impacted teams to become very familiar with as-is and to-be processes as they relate to the new Digital Procurement Solution (Supplier Data, Spend Data, Supplier Performance Management, Contracts, Sourcing, etc...) Gather and document processes (where they do not already exist); with sign off of impacted teams Through the process activities outlined above, capture key nuances to highlight as part of change management. Testing Help identify critical test scenarios based on mandatory fields and known fields/processes that are monitored closely to ensure no disruption of business. Participate in UAT Sessions Other ⇒ Support DPS team in other activities such as reporting and timeline. Qualifications Familiarity with SAP, Microsoft Navision D365 and/or Oracle Must have Excel and/or Google skills General understanding of Procurement & Finance Processes (IE Vendor Master / Accounts Payable / P2P) Bilingual (LATAM) but not mandatory Familiarity w/Zycus or Other SaaS Digital Procurement solutions Well disciplined; with ability to work remotely
html_job_description:
Hybrid Mode Workstream - ERP IMPLEMENTATION SPECIALIST


Support AME Digital Procurement Solution Team for implementation of the SaaS (Zycus) solution


User Interface Fields

  • Identification & mapping of fields needed for Hybrid Mode (ERP to SaaS Solution) Creation/Modification/Deactivation/Holds; working closely to validate with local impacted teams and BIS counterpart.
  • Assist with populating needed templates (IE UI configuration, workflow, etc…).


Process & Change Management

  • Partner with impacted teams to become very familiar with as-is and to-be processes as they relate to the new Digital Procurement Solution (Supplier Data, Spend Data, Supplier Performance Management, Contracts, Sourcing, etc...)
  • Gather and document processes (where they do not already exist); with sign off of impacted teams
  • Through the process activities outlined above, capture key nuances to highlight as part of change management.


Testing

  • Help identify critical test scenarios based on mandatory fields and known fields/processes that are monitored closely to ensure no disruption of business.
  • Participate in UAT Sessions


Other ⇒ Support DPS team in other activities such as reporting and timeline.


Qualifications

  • Familiarity with SAP, Microsoft Navision D365 and/or Oracle
  • Must have Excel and/or Google skills
  • General understanding of Procurement & Finance Processes (IE Vendor Master / Accounts Payable / P2P)
  • Bilingual (LATAM) but not mandatory
  • Familiarity w/Zycus or Other SaaS Digital Procurement solutions
  • Well disciplined; with ability to work remotely

job_description: Job Summary: Full Time // Miami, FL or Remote Responsible for the automation of releases, monitoring the systems, managing exceptions, application support, systems reliability, and cloud infrastructure for our cloud-based, multi-tenant automated accounts receivable system. You will be a key player in growing this application and taking it to the next level to handle greater amounts of load volume and scalability. This application is built using Ruby on Rails on the Azure and AWS platforms. Monitor the systems for performance and exceptions Perform root cause analysis of faults Support the application, addressing issues directly or with software engineers Automate deployment processes and other routines Participate in technical design, especially with regards to infrastructure Collaborate with a distributed team of remote workers Respond quickly to resolve issues Engineer solutions to any problems that arise Participate in daily standups and weekly knowledge-sharing presentations Manage employee laptops via JAMF Administer network connections and VPNs Knowledge and Expertise of: AWS – S3, EC2, EKS, SQS, SNS, SES, Lambda, VPC, Route53, CloudFormation, CloudFront Azure – VPC, HA, scalability, security, gateways, virtual hosts Experience supporting a large, enterprise Ruby on Rails application Kubernetes and Docker Performance monitoring tools like New Relic Working with CI systems like Semaphore Exception monitoring tools Log analyzer tools Good PostgreSQL administration experience Strong Linux administration skills Ruby for writing scripts Networking Best practices for security Team-based development and collaboration, via Slack and other remote-friendly technologies Nontechnical Requirements: Time management skills An ownership mentality Must be able to pick up complex systems quickly Prior experience working remotely US work authorization (no visas) Available for collaboration between 9am and 5pm Eastern Time Benefits: This is a full-time, salaried position with health insurance (medical / dental / vision), paid vacation, and 401(k) with matching. Salary will be based on experience. About Us: DadeSystems automates the invoice-to-cash application process to increase efficiency and accelerate cash flow. DadePay AR Automation, part of a SaaS suite of integrated products, automatically captures all incoming payments, including cash, checks, ACH, EFT, and credit cards. DadePay automatically matches payments and remittances to open invoices using patented technologies and machine learning, with updates to the companies’ ERP systems. The DadePay product suite also includes an ePayment customer portal and Mobile AR application. The entire product suite is part of a single enterprise platform and serves multiple industries, including B2B and C2B industries. Founded in 2011, DadeSystems is privately held, and backed by recent investments from Napier Park Financial Partners and Wells Fargo Strategic Capital. This position can be based remotely, or in Miami, FL.
salary_offered: This is a full-time, salaried position with health insurance (medical / dental / vision), paid vacation, and 401(k) with matching. Salary will be based on experience.
html_job_description:
Job Summary:


Full Time // Miami, FL or Remote


Responsible for the automation of releases, monitoring the systems, managing exceptions, application support, systems reliability, and cloud infrastructure for our cloud-based, multi-tenant automated accounts receivable system. You will be a key player in growing this application and taking it to the next level to handle greater amounts of load volume and scalability. This application is built using Ruby on Rails on the Azure and AWS platforms.


  • Monitor the systems for performance and exceptions
  • Perform root cause analysis of faults
  • Support the application, addressing issues directly or with software engineers
  • Automate deployment processes and other routines
  • Participate in technical design, especially with regards to infrastructure
  • Collaborate with a distributed team of remote workers
  • Respond quickly to resolve issues
  • Engineer solutions to any problems that arise
  • Participate in daily standups and weekly knowledge-sharing presentations
  • Manage employee laptops via JAMF
  • Administer network connections and VPNs

Knowledge and Expertise of:

  • AWS – S3, EC2, EKS, SQS, SNS, SES, Lambda, VPC, Route53, CloudFormation, CloudFront
  • Azure – VPC, HA, scalability, security, gateways, virtual hosts
  • Experience supporting a large, enterprise Ruby on Rails application
  • Kubernetes and Docker
  • Performance monitoring tools like New Relic
  • Working with CI systems like Semaphore
  • Exception monitoring tools
  • Log analyzer tools
  • Good PostgreSQL administration experience
  • Strong Linux administration skills
  • Ruby for writing scripts
  • Networking
  • Best practices for security
  • Team-based development and collaboration, via Slack and other remote-friendly technologies

Nontechnical Requirements:

  • Time management skills
  • An ownership mentality
  • Must be able to pick up complex systems quickly
  • Prior experience working remotely
  • US work authorization (no visas)
  • Available for collaboration between 9am and 5pm Eastern Time

Benefits:

This is a full-time, salaried position with health insurance (medical / dental / vision), paid vacation, and 401(k) with matching. Salary will be based on experience.


About Us:

DadeSystems automates the invoice-to-cash application process to increase efficiency and accelerate cash flow. DadePay AR Automation, part of a SaaS suite of integrated products, automatically captures all incoming payments, including cash, checks, ACH, EFT, and credit cards. DadePay automatically matches payments and remittances to open invoices using patented technologies and machine learning, with updates to the companies’ ERP systems. The DadePay product suite also includes an ePayment customer portal and Mobile AR application. The entire product suite is part of a single enterprise platform and serves multiple industries, including B2B and C2B industries.


Founded in 2011, DadeSystems is privately held, and backed by recent investments from Napier Park Financial Partners and Wells Fargo Strategic Capital.


This position can be based remotely, or in Miami, FL.

job_description: Are you looking to make an impact at a growing company? We're looking for a team of salespeople to sell our ground-breaking app to local restaurants across the US. Just when COVID-19 times are getting hard, we offer the opportunity to make an impact in the restaurant industry, being part of our company will give a set of tools and skills to make it through these pandemic times This is a part-time position that offers a competitive commission for sales to local restaurants. We’re offering a truly valuable service to help restaurants train their employees better, and want to grow our install base in small restaurants and franchises. In this position, you’ll be reporting directly to company leadership at Mr. Tomato to help us build out and execute our on-the-ground sales strategy. You’ll be performing outreach to local restaurants to gauge interest in our product and use this information to sell our app to local businesses in your area. The ideal candidate is proactive, tech-savvy, and impact-driven. We are on a mission to help restaurants become early adopters of next-generation training technology, and we need your help to sell them on our vision of the future. To apply, visit and fill out our interactive application https://go.mrtomato.com/quiz Job Types: Part-time, Commission Pay: Up to $2,000.00 per month Benefits: Flexible schedule Referral program Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Commission pay COVID-19 considerations: In this position you will be selling an application that greatly helps restaurants fight with COVID-19 consequences. Application Question: Please go through our interactive quiz to apply https://go.mrtomato.com/quiz Work Location: Fully Remote Work Remotely: Yes

job_description: Do you enjoy trying new foods and experiencing other cultures? Are you looking for a chance to make a direct impact on a growing business? Then this could be the opportunity for you! Universal Yums started in 2014 with a simple concept: give people an opportunity to try unique foods and flavors from around the world. Our flagship product is a monthly subscription box offering snacks and candies from a different country each month. In 2019, we were ranked #190 on Inc. 5000’s Fastest Growing Private Companies, and have been featured in Forbes, Buzzfeed, The New York Times, and the Daily Mail for our novel product and our rapid success. About the Job We’re looking for a tech-savvy and Customer Experience Specialist to accurately and thoroughly resolve any issues that arise with our customers. Here at Universal Yums, we try to keep the customer top of mind in all that we do, and you’ll play a role in ensuring that their experience traveling the world with us is excellent. In this role, you’ll join our Customer Experience team, which is responsible for all customer-facing interactions with potential and existing customers. Job Responsibilities Respond to customer inquiries via email, live chat, or social media. Thoroughly resolve customers’ issues, including inputting replacement orders and issuing refunds. Identify opportunities to improve our customers' experiences with Universal Yums, raising common issues, suggesting new features, and sharing new ideas to management. Are You Our Ideal Customer Experience Specialist? If you’re asking that, you’re asking the right question. Our ideal candidate is enthusiastic, driven, and eager to gain unique experiences that will build a strong foundation for their career. Here are the qualities we’re looking for in a candidate: Excellent English written communication skills with strong grammar and spelling Average typing speed >70 WPM Experience in Zendesk a plus Strong computer skills with an aptitude for technology Ability to navigate through multiple websites simultaneously Job Type: Full-time Pay: $42,000.00 per year Benefits: Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Parental leave Retirement plan Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Experience: Zendesk: 1 year (Preferred) Company's website: www.universalyums.com Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19
html_job_description:
Do you enjoy trying new foods and experiencing other cultures? Are you looking for a chance to make a direct impact on a growing business? Then this could be the opportunity for you!

Universal Yums started in 2014 with a simple concept: give people an opportunity to try unique foods and flavors from around the world. Our flagship product is a monthly subscription box offering snacks and candies from a different country each month. In 2019, we were ranked #190 on Inc. 5000’s Fastest Growing Private Companies, and have been featured in Forbes, Buzzfeed, The New York Times, and the Daily Mail for our novel product and our rapid success.

About the Job

We’re looking for a tech-savvy and Customer Experience Specialist to accurately and thoroughly resolve any issues that arise with our customers. Here at Universal Yums, we try to keep the customer top of mind in all that we do, and you’ll play a role in ensuring that their experience traveling the world with us is excellent.

In this role, you’ll join our Customer Experience team, which is responsible for all customer-facing interactions with potential and existing customers.

Job Responsibilities

  • Respond to customer inquiries via email, live chat, or social media.
  • Thoroughly resolve customers’ issues, including inputting replacement orders and issuing refunds.
  • Identify opportunities to improve our customers' experiences with Universal Yums, raising common issues, suggesting new features, and sharing new ideas to management.

Are You Our Ideal Customer Experience Specialist?

If you’re asking that, you’re asking the right question. Our ideal candidate is enthusiastic, driven, and eager to gain unique experiences that will build a strong foundation for their career. Here are the qualities we’re looking for in a candidate:

  • Excellent English written communication skills with strong grammar and spelling
  • Average typing speed >70 WPM
  • Experience in Zendesk a plus
  • Strong computer skills with an aptitude for technology
  • Ability to navigate through multiple websites simultaneously

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $42,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Parental leave
  • Retirement plan
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Zendesk: 1 year (Preferred)

Company's website:

  • www.universalyums.com

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

job_description: 4.3| ||Part-time|15 hours ago| Full Job Description For middle and upper school students in remote learning. Ensure they are engaged, assist with executive functioning, howeowrk, organization. Proficiency in Spanish desired.

3.1| || Quick Apply |Full-time|2 hours ago| Full Job Description Revolution Prep is the world leader in K-12 live online test preparation and academic tutoring. Our model of attracting the top educator talent in the country by making the tutor position a full-time profession has led to industry-leading results and satisfaction. The nation's top public and private schools partner with us to deliver college prep programming for students. The Academic Advisor is the one who sells and manages these programs and serves as primary point of contact to parents seeking academic and/or test preparation for their child. Qualifications: -experience with B2C direct phone sales, strong consultative sales skills -experience with B2B relationship/account management -strong work ethic in following up with a large lead base by phone, up to 50+ phone calls per day -ability to work from home office using innovative computer-based tools -has entrepreneurial spirit and results driven -requires local travel within region to visit schools and host events (80% home office / 20% in field) -college degree Duties: -serve as primary contact for parents within a local territory and selling live online tutoring & test preparation programs -follow up by phone with parents who register for events to sell and enroll in tutoring programs -connect with parents at events and via referrals from client schools who have interest in Revolution services -be able to travel within the Greater New York City (including Long Island) area. -visit client school sites frequently to give updates on Revolution Prep resources and industry developments -plan, promote, and attend college admission events at client schools -work strategically throughout the week, evenings and weekends (as needed) to achieve goals and business needs. Compensation: -salary of 50k, plus commission -uncapped commission plan based on individual sales -year one total compensation range $50,000 - $70,000 Job Type: Full-time Pay: $50,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Employee discount Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Commission pay | Quick Apply
4.3| ||Full-time|15 hours ago| Full Job Description New born care, light cleaning and laundry. Parents work full time and sometimes will work from home. Needs to have newborn experience

2.9| || Quick Apply |Full-time|19 hours ago| Full Job Description Why Join ADAPT? It's more than a job; it's a calling. It's where passion meets purpose. ADAPT Community Network, formerly United Cerebral Palsy (UCP) of NYC provides a multitude of services to people with developmental disabilities. At ADAPT, we are 3,000 strong, and it takes every one of us to empower the lives of the people we support. With caring and great resources at hand, we know what it takes to help people live fuller, happier, healthier lives. Our employees show their commitment to the people we support every day, and we all deliver on our promise to provide innovative and comprehensive services to individuals with developmental disabilities. For your next career move, apply with us at ADAPT Community Network! Wherever you work among our many locations around New York City, ADAPT offers paid training, competitive benefits, and we foster a team culture of learning, support, collaboration and career growth. SUMMARY Under general supervision, is responsible for devoting his/her attention to the care and development of the residents in one of the Agency’s residential facilities. Interacts in a manner which fosters dignity and learning in a way that helps lead to greater independence. Helps create a homelike atmosphere for residents in an agency facility. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES The duties and responsibilities of the Residence Program Specialist will include, but are not limited to the following: Provides care and assists with personal development and independence of residents. Ensures that all measures for safety and well-being are maintained at highest level Trains residents in activities of daily living and in development of self-help and social skills. Maintains a personalized, homelike atmosphere in residence facility. Attends weekly staff meetings as well as any other assigned meetings and in-service training. Prepares concise written reports including Incident Reports, Residents’ Progress Notes and other reports as assigned. Responds to crisis situations and medical emergencies, including accidents by taking quick and decisive action. Ensures actions are conducted in a manner that prevents abuse and reports observations of co-workers who may be abusive in accordance with established procedures. Administers appropriate first aid based on visible symptoms and resident history in accordance with established guidelines and accepted first aid practices. Summons police, fire, ambulance or other emergency personnel if situation warrants it. If emergency has caused resident to exhibit behavior that is threatening or dangerous, in accordance with OPWDD approved Behavior Management guidelines, may have to restrain that resident. Transports residents in agency vehicles to and from work, shopping, programs, restaurants, movies, doctor’s appointments, etc. ADAPT Community Network is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Qualified candidates of diverse ethnic and racial backgrounds and status are encouraged to apply for vacant positions at all levels | Quick Apply

4.3| ||Full-time|15 hours ago| Full Job Description Our first child is 22 months old and we would love to work with a child caregiver. Duties would include care and playtime with child, and some light laundry, dishes, and other tasks around the home. We like him to play outside a lot and he also loves cars and to read. We ask that the caregiver be very COVID conscious and up to date with all vaccinations to be around our boy. We keep a very small bubble (we have not been to a restaurant or bar since January, our groceries are delivered, we work from home, etc.). He has a happy disposition and is very curious. Thank you so much.

3.7| ||Full-time|39 minutes ago| Full Job Description We hope you're interested in building a home with us. Even if you don't feel that you meet every requirement listed in this job description, we still encourage you to apply. About the Inventory Management Team You will be part of the Inventory Planning organization is responsible for the strategic planning of inventory positions to drive sales, manage inventory turn and meet or exceed financial targets for your area of responsibility. Inventory associates are innovators, optimizers and problem solvers who are constantly seeking opportunities to move the business forward. You will collaborate with other business functions to support a product strategy intended to meet our customer's needs. Overview of the Supply Chain Coordinator role You will own the creation, maintenance and tracking of Purchase Orders (POs) for assigned departments. You will act as a liaison between Inventory Management, Merchandising, Sourcing and global vendors to ensure every order is processed and delivered on time. Responsibilities Create and maintain purchase orders based on the needs of cross-functional partners or supply chain constraints Communicate and manage purchase order and transportation information with agents and vendors Review master tracker & GTN POC on a weekly basis to resolve outstanding PO issues Track and update customer-facing order dates to properly reflect customer backorder dates and receipt forecasts Operate a computer and communicate via telephone Transport materials and equipment and lift, move, and carry objects up to 50 pounds on a limited basis Criteria Detailed oriented with a keen eye for accuracy Comfortable entering and retrieving data from multiple systems Good time management skills with ability to prioritize and shift focus as needed Strong follow-through skills, especially following up with multiple teams to get information needed to resolve pending POs Strong written and verbal communication skills - able to write succinct messages and communicate clearly Ability to perform work onsite in the San Francisco office full-time pending state, local, and Company return-to-work guidance during and after the COVID-19 pandemic. We believe in People First We firmly believe that working in a culture focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion spurs innovation, creates healthy and high-performing teams, and delivers superior customer experiences. Our DEI initiatives prompt associate participation and engagement, aligning with our core vision to reflect the communities where we do business and put people first. Benefits Just for You Depending on your position and your location, here are a few highlights of what you might be eligible for: A generous discount on all Williams-Sonoma, Inc. brands A 401(k) plan and other investment opportunities Paid vacations, holidays, and time off to volunteer Health benefits, dental and vision insurance, including same-sex domestic partner benefits Tax-free commuter benefits A wellness program that supports your physical, financial and emotional health Your Journey in Continued Learning In-person and online learning opportunities through WSI University Cross-brand and cross-function career opportunities Resources for self-development Advisor (Mentor) program Career development workshops and learning programs Speaker series WSI will not now or in the future commence an immigration case or "sponsor" an individual for this position (for example, H-1B or other employment-based immigration This role is not eligible for relocation assistance. Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Williams-Sonoma, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, or other applicable state or local laws and ordinances. Our Company Founded in 1956, Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is the premier specialty retailer of high-quality products for the kitchen and home in the United States. Our family of brands are Williams Sonoma, Williams Sonoma Home, Pottery Barn, Pottery Barn teen, pottery barn kids, Rejuvenation, Mark & Graham, west elm, or Outward. These brands are among the best known and most respected in the industry. We offer beautifully-designed, stylish and functional products for every area of the home, including the kitchen, living room, bedroom, home office, closet, laundry room and even outdoor spaces. We've seen some big changes since our first brick-and-mortar store opened more than half of a century ago. What hasn't changed is our passion for high-quality products, functional design, outstanding customer service, and enhancing the lives of our customers and the communities where we operate. Today, we're a multi-brand, multi-channel, global enterprise supported by state-of-the-art technology and some of the most talented teams in retailing - and we're always looking for new energy and ideas.

3.9| ||Full-time|3 hours ago| Full Job Description Discover Your Career at Emory University: Emory University is a leading research university that fosters excellence and attracts world-class talent to innovate today and prepare leaders for the future. We welcome candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of our academic community. Description: Dr. Anne Piantadosi’s laboratory at the Emory University School of Medicine is seeking an inquisitive, highly-motivated postdoctoral researcher with expertise in computational biology to study the genomics of emerging viruses, including SARS-CoV-2. The repeated and unpredictable threat of emerging viruses is evident in the spread of known viruses, such as dengue virus, and the identification of new viruses, such as SARS-CoV-2. The field of viral genomics lies at a critical intersection of medicine, public health, and basic research. It guides fundamental work ranging from viral discovery to studies of pathogenicity, and directly informs the treatment and prevention of disease. We are a nimble, closely-knit research team, large enough to accomplish great work, yet small enough to ensure that each member has the mentorship needed to grow toward their next career goal. Our current active projects include studying the diversity and evolution of SARS-CoV-2, dengue virus, and Powassan virus. We also use metagenomic sequencing to detect and discover unappreciated/novel viruses in patients and mosquito/tick vectors. Our projects combine clinical, laboratory, and computational approaches, and we are delighted to collaborate closely with clinicians and researchers across a wide spectrum of expertise on projects with high importance to patient care and public health. The candidate for this position will have the opportunity to lead computational projects investigating population-level virus evolution, within-host virus evolution, and/or metagenomics/virome studies. In addition to planning, conducting, and publishing research, they will contribute to the professional development of undergraduate and graduate students, and work closely with research associates in the wet lab to ensure projects proceed smoothly. This position benefits from the rich academic environment of the Emory School of Medicine, Emory University, the Yerkes National Primate Research Center, and the Emory Vaccine Center. There is ample opportunity for high-impact projects, facilitated by our existing collaborations, close integration with clinical laboratories, and advanced molecular wet lab. Qualifications: PhD in bioinformatics, computational biology, evolutionary biology, virology or related. The ideal candidate will have a background in phylogenetics and/or metagenomics. A track record of outstanding written and verbal communication Superior organizational skills Experience working with massively parallel sequencing data Experience working on cloud platforms Proficiency with command-line Linux/UNIX systems Use of basic software engineering practices such as version control A history of, or interest in, contributing to open-source software is beneficial. Experience with wet lab sequencing methods is highly beneficial. This is a two-year position, with potential for extension depending on funding. There is the opportunity to work remotely. To apply online and sbmitt a cover letter, CV, and contact information for 3 references. Emory Supports a Diverse and Inclusive Culture: Emory University is dedicated to providing equal opportunities and equal access to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, ethnic or national origin, gender, genetic information, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, and veteran's status. Emory University does not discriminate in admissions, educational programs, or employment on the basis of any factor stated above or prohibited under applicable law. Students, faculty, and staff are assured of participation in University programs and in the use of facilities without such discrimination. Emory University complies with Executive Order 11246, as amended, Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Era Veteran's Readjustment Assistance Act, and applicable executive orders, federal and state regulations regarding nondiscrimination, equal opportunity and affirmative action. Emory University is committed to achieving a diverse workforce through application of its affirmative action, equal opportunity and nondiscrimination policy in all aspects of employment including recruitment, hiring, promotions, transfers, discipline, terminations, wage and salary administration, benefits, and training. Inquiries regarding this policy should be directed to the Emory University Department of Equity and Inclusion, 201 Dowman Drive, Administration Building, Atlanta, GA 30322. Telephone: 404-727-9867 (V) | 404-712-2049 (TDD). Emory University is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities upon request. job_description: Are you passionate about serving local businesses through this pandemic? Do you enjoy growing professionally and personally? Would you want to work with a group of people who become your best friends? Job Description We are seeking enthusiastic, optimistic and fun loving individual. As a Brand Ambassador, you will have the opportunity to provide local businesses with solutions to the problems created in this pandemic. You will be able to equip these businesses with the tools they need to work remotely if need be, while protecting them from scam calls, all while cutting their telecommunication expense by 50 percent. One expectation of our representatives is not only to grow within our company but also to grow personally as well. To help with this we provide our representatives with a library of books, consistent self-development meetings, networking opportunities, a fitness center, and a basketball court. As a representative with us, you will be joining a family, that is our number one core value. As we continue to hit our goal of growing by 100 percent yearly, our main focus is maintaining the culture of a family environment. Responsibilities Meet with 30 to 60 clients- Our goal is to grow by 100 percent this year as a company. Grow territory- Oversee and help local business develop Presentations to customers - Focus on the problems our products solve for local businesses Customer relationship management - Use our client tracking system to maximize effectiveness Be a Leader- Oversee and develop a small sales team Familiarize with product - Understand how we are providing solutions for local businesses through this pandemic Product Development - Use your creativity to help us better our product and continue to get better Self-Development- Equip oneself with the resources to maximize their potential Self- Managment- No micromanagment, we focus on results, not methods Value drive- Maintaining our family environment as we grow Proactive- Focusing on what we can control; attitude and outlook Qualifications Excellent communication skills Customer service minded Self confidence Territory management Goal- Oriented BA/ BS (Preferred) Incentives Paid travel Networking with business owners Weekly and monthly bonuses Onsite fitness center Onsite library Onsite kitchen Onsite basketball court Business mobile phone line Sams club premium membership If the job description and responsibilities don't fit what you're looking for, then we wish you the best of luck in your job hunt. If it is what you're looking for, then please click "apply" for the opportunity to become apart of our team and family. html_job_description:
Are you passionate about serving local businesses through this pandemic?

Do you enjoy growing professionally and personally?

Would you want to work with a group of people who become your best friends?


Job Description

We are seeking enthusiastic, optimistic and fun loving individual. As a Brand Ambassador, you will have the opportunity to provide local businesses with solutions to the problems created in this pandemic. You will be able to equip these businesses with the tools they need to work remotely if need be, while protecting them from scam calls, all while cutting their telecommunication expense by 50 percent. One expectation of our representatives is not only to grow within our company but also to grow personally as well. To help with this we provide our representatives with a library of books, consistent self-development meetings, networking opportunities, a fitness center, and a basketball court. As a representative with us, you will be joining a family, that is our number one core value. As we continue to hit our goal of growing by 100 percent yearly, our main focus is maintaining the culture of a family environment.


Responsibilities

  • Meet with 30 to 60 clients- Our goal is to grow by 100 percent this year as a company.
  • Grow territory- Oversee and help local business develop
  • Presentations to customers - Focus on the problems our products solve for local businesses
  • Customer relationship management - Use our client tracking system to maximize effectiveness
  • Be a Leader- Oversee and develop a small sales team
  • Familiarize with product - Understand how we are providing solutions for local businesses through this pandemic
  • Product Development - Use your creativity to help us better our product and continue to get better
  • Self-Development- Equip oneself with the resources to maximize their potential
  • Self- Managment- No micromanagment, we focus on results, not methods
  • Value drive- Maintaining our family environment as we grow
  • Proactive- Focusing on what we can control; attitude and outlook


Qualifications

  • Excellent communication skills
  • Customer service minded
  • Self confidence
  • Territory management
  • Goal- Oriented
  • BA/ BS (Preferred)


Incentives

  • Paid travel
  • Networking with business owners
  • Weekly and monthly bonuses
  • Onsite fitness center
  • Onsite library
  • Onsite kitchen
  • Onsite basketball court
  • Business mobile phone line
  • Sams club premium membership


If the job description and responsibilities don't fit what you're looking for, then we wish you the best of luck in your job hunt. If it is what you're looking for, then please click "apply" for the opportunity to become apart of our team and family.


Company Description


Our mission at Simba Sales is to provide opportunity & strategic growth for our team, clients & community; for generations to come. As we continue to provide our team with the resources necessary to grow themselves not only professionally but personally as well, we know in turn we will be better equipped to serve our clients needs. As we continue to come through for our clients it gives us more opportunity to give back to our community. As a value driven organization this will make impacts on generations to come. We are proud to say during the pandemic we stayed true to our values and our mission, and we did not downsize nor do any layoffs. By staying true to ourselves we have doubled in size through the pandemic and will continue to aspire to achieve our mission.


Simba Sales Inc.


Why Work Here?


Family work environment, goal oriented, and core value driven!

Our mission at Simba Sales is to provide opportunity & strategic growth for our team, clients & community; for generations to come. As we continue to provide our team with the resources necessary to grow themselves not only professionally but personally as well, we know in turn we will be better equipped to serve our clients needs. As we continue to come through for our clients it gives us more opportunity to give back to our community. As a value driven organization this will make impacts on generations to come. We are proud to say during the pandemic we stayed true to our values and our mission, and we did not downsize nor do any layoffs. By staying true to ourselves we have doubled in size through the pandemic and will continue to aspire to achieve our mission.

Louisville, KY

40207 USA

3.5| ||Full-time|11 hours ago| Full Job Description Welcome to Kodak Alaris. Kodak Alaris is a company born from one of the world's most iconic brands, Kodak. Kodak Alaris is passionate about using technology to transform organizations and improve people's lives across the globe. Our digital scanners and intelligent state-of-the-art software services manage data in some of the world's largest companies, and our photographic paper production, printing kiosks and suite of consumer apps help people capture and connect with the emotional moments that define all our lives. Our mission at Kodak Alaris remains crystal clear; to transform and improve the profitability of the portfolio of businesses that make up Kodak Alaris, to create further value in a culturally renewed values-driven Company; a Company that invests in growth businesses, systematically and reliably delivers on its financial commitments, operates within an efficient, cost-effective infrastructure and based on a cultural foundation of innovation, transparency, discipline and accountability. Our vision for each one of our businesses remains constant: to be recognized by the market as the leading provider of products and services in each of the segments we participate in. We want to lead in each key industry we participate in through better products, better quality and reliability, better customer service, the best and the brightest employee talent, along with world class partners around the globe. Our well-established Kodak Alaris values that we live and breathe by can be defined by the acronym I-ACT: Innovation as the core of Kodak Alaris as a technology company * Accountability to deliver on our commitments * Customer Satisfaction in all aspects of our business * Teamwork in how we resolve issues and grow our portfolio Position Summary The ideal candidate is an early career software/computer engineer who will assume a role on our platform development team to develop and deliver technology solutions needed to support Kodak Moments On-Premise and Cloud applications. The platform serves 100K+ In-store Kiosk systems, 8M+ mobile applications and US Web Site making it easy for consumers to create personalized imaging products that can be fulfilled and picked up in-store in hours or fulfilled and mailed to their home. You will work closely with the team to design, develop and test complex application software in a modern development environment using Agile Development techniques and processes. The individual will work remotely with the Rochester, NY development team. Key Responsibilities Build platform components and services used by our front-end Web, Mobile and Kiosk systems Design reliable, but simple solutions to complex problems at scale Design, develop, document, test, and monitor our solutions/services utilizing technologies best suited to solve the problem Integrate 3rd party imaging solutions to extend overall capabilities that will run in a highly scalable and robust system Test and evaluate new technologies to provide solutions for implementation Consistently delivering against commitments Job Requirements Qualifications & Experience Familiarity with all phases of the software development life cycle, including Agile/Scrum methodologies Experience developing and deploying imaging solutions using Cloud services that are highly scalable utilizing IaaS, PaaS, serverless functions. Design modern RESTful services that are robust and scalable Knowledge of event driven design is a plus Experience developing object-oriented programming applications and components using C#, .NET Framework including .NET Core and ASP.NET are a plus. Technical competency in software development and good understanding of software design principles and processes Excellent problem solving and analytical skills Great communication skills, work ethic and willingness to be a team player Experience with Azure DevOps, Git, and Nuget Packaging a plus Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related degree. Skills & Competencies Cloud Computing with AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Database development, query optimization and handling large datasets in technologies like Microsoft SQL Server or NoSQL databases Technical competency in software development and good understanding of software design principles and processes Kodak Alaris provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. .

We are searching for an organized, attentive Bank Teller to provide exceptional service to our customers by handling routine tasks, such as processing payments, accepting deposits, and handling withdrawals. The Bank Teller will respond to customer requests and inquiries, make recommendations about bank products and services, maintain and balance cash supplies, and keep track of bank records and financial information. To succeed as a Bank Teller, you should have a professional appearance and a customer-focused attitude. You should be courteous, efficient, helpful, and accurate. Bank Teller Responsibilities: Assisting customers with processing transactions, such as deposits, withdrawals, or payments, resolving complaints or account discrepancies, and answering questions. Informing customers about bank products and services. Tracking, recording, reporting, and storing information related to transactions, bank supplies, and customers, ensuring all information is accurate and complete. Maintaining and balancing cash drawers and reconciling discrepancies. Packaging cash and rolling coins to be stored in drawers or the bank vault. Keeping a clean, organized work area and a professional appearance. Handling currency, transactions, and confidential information in a responsible manner. Using software to track bank information and generate reports. Following all bank financial and security regulations and procedures. Bank Teller Requirements: Bachelor’s degree Ability to pass a background check. Exceptional time management, communication, and customer service skills. Basic math and computer skills. High level of accountability, efficiency, and accuracy. Strong sales skills are a plus. Professional appearance and courteous manner. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $45,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Wire Transfer: 1 year (Preferred) Banking: 1 year (Preferred) Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19

We are searching for an organized, attentive Bank Teller to provide exceptional service to our customers by handling routine tasks, such as processing payments, accepting deposits, and handling withdrawals. The Bank Teller will respond to customer requests and inquiries, make recommendations about bank products and services, maintain and balance cash supplies, and keep track of bank records and financial information.

To succeed as a Bank Teller, you should have a professional appearance and a customer-focused attitude. You should be courteous, efficient, helpful, and accurate.
Bank Teller Responsibilities:

  • Assisting customers with processing transactions, such as deposits, withdrawals, or payments, resolving complaints or account discrepancies, and answering questions.
  • Informing customers about bank products and services.
  • Tracking, recording, reporting, and storing information related to transactions, bank supplies, and customers, ensuring all information is accurate and complete.
  • Maintaining and balancing cash drawers and reconciling discrepancies.
  • Packaging cash and rolling coins to be stored in drawers or the bank vault.
  • Keeping a clean, organized work area and a professional appearance.
  • Handling currency, transactions, and confidential information in a responsible manner.
  • Using software to track bank information and generate reports.
  • Following all bank financial and security regulations and procedures.

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Ability to pass a background check.
  • Exceptional time management, communication, and customer service skills.
  • Basic math and computer skills.
  • High level of accountability, efficiency, and accuracy.
  • Strong sales skills are a plus.
  • Professional appearance and courteous manner.

job_description: 2.9| || Quick Apply |Full-time|3 hours ago| Full Job Description Why Join ADAPT? It's more than a job; it's a calling. It's where passion meets purpose. ADAPT Community Network, formerly United Cerebral Palsy (UCP) of NYC provides a multitude of services to people with developmental disabilities. At ADAPT, we are 3,000 strong, and it takes every one of us to empower the lives of the people we support. With caring and great resources at hand, we know what it takes to help people live fuller, happier, healthier lives. Our employees show their commitment to the people we support every day, and we all deliver on our promise to provide innovative and comprehensive services to individuals with developmental disabilities. For your next career move, apply with us at ADAPT Community Network! Wherever you work among our many locations around New York City, ADAPT offers paid training, competitive benefits, and we foster a team culture of learning, support, collaboration and career growth. SUMMARY Under general supervision, is responsible for devoting his/her attention to the care and development of the residents in one of the Agency’s residential facilities. Interacts in a manner which fosters dignity and learning in a way that helps lead to greater independence. Helps create a homelike atmosphere for residents in an agency facility. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES The duties and responsibilities of the Residence Program Specialist will include, but are not limited to the following: Provides care and assists with personal development and independence of residents. Ensures that all measures for safety and well-being are maintained at highest level Trains residents in activities of daily living and in development of self-help and social skills. Maintains a personalized, homelike atmosphere in residence facility. Attends weekly staff meetings as well as any other assigned meetings and in-service training. Prepares concise written reports including Incident Reports, Residents’ Progress Notes and other reports as assigned. Responds to crisis situations and medical emergencies, including accidents by taking quick and decisive action. Ensures actions are conducted in a manner that prevents abuse and reports observations of co-workers who may be abusive in accordance with established procedures. Administers appropriate first aid based on visible symptoms and resident history in accordance with established guidelines and accepted first aid practices. Summons police, fire, ambulance or other emergency personnel if situation warrants it. If emergency has caused resident to exhibit behavior that is threatening or dangerous, in accordance with OPWDD approved Behavior Management guidelines, may have to restrain that resident. Transports residents in agency vehicles to and from work, shopping, programs, restaurants, movies, doctor’s appointments, etc. ADAPT Community Network is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Qualified candidates of diverse ethnic and racial backgrounds and status are encouraged to apply for vacant positions at all levels | Quick Apply

job_description: 3.2| ||Part-time|13 hours ago| Full Job Description East Bay Community Action Program (EBCAP) is seeking part time (16.25 hours per week) Teacher Assistants for our Newport Family & Child Opportunity Zone (NFCOZ) Program at the Pell Elementary School in Newport, RI. NFCOZ provides services and referrals to Newport children and their families in school and community settings, in partnership with Newport Public Schools, parents, and the community. EBCAP is committed to the safety of our employees and clients during this COVID-19 medical crisis. We are currently conducting our interviews remotely. Our new hires are attending orientation and program specific orientations remotely. Many of our employees can and will continue to work remotely during this crisis. The Teacher Assistants work in collaboration with the Kids Connect Clinician and Champion Childcare team to provide support and individualized interventions to children with social, emotional and behavioral difficulties to ensure that they have the opportunity for a high quality, nurturing and safe learning experience and to optimize their opportunity for success. The ideal candidates will assist in the supervision of students, utilize positive approach consistent with Positive Behavioral Intervention and Supports model, and maintain the philosophy and mission of the program. To meet the educational requirements of this position, the Teacher Assistant must hold a High School Diploma or a GED certification, and have either: Formal Training related to child or youth development. OR At least one year of supervised experience working with school age children in a group setting to assume the role of school age staff. Candidates with Associates degree and/or Teacher Assistant Certification are preferred. Candidates who are bilingual in Spanish are strongly encouraged to apply. The NFCOZ will be carefully following state guidelines and protocols for operating a childcare program to protect children, staff, and families during the COVID-19 pandemic. Thank you for your interest in employment opportunities at East Bay Community Action Program. EBCAP is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to providing a diverse work environment.

job_description: 3.0| || Quick Apply |Full-time|13 hours ago| Full Job Description TICO is an equipment solutions company in business since 1946. TICO manufactures, owns, and operates a fleet of over 1500 terminal tractors (jockey trucks) and trailers deployed in major U.S. ports. TICO maintains an on port and off port fueling operation where we service our own equipment as well as customer equipment. We are looking for a highly motivated and customer service oriented Utility Person for our Savannah location. SUMMARY Perform custodial/cleaning and maintenance duties in offices, warehouses, industrial areas, and other building interiors. Perform exterior grounds/facility maintenance. Follow procedures in the use of chemical cleaners and power equipment to prevent damage to Company property. Perform materials movement and storage duties utilizing a forklift, jockey truck, and/or pickup truck. Perform driving duty to deliver parts for equipment repair/maintenance to other Company locations and to vendors. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Perform janitorial services for the facility by performing the following job duties: Clean and maintain in an orderly condition facility working areas and washrooms, or premises of an office, etc. Follow safety procedures in the use of chemical cleaners and power equipment. Sweep/vacuum, and mop floors. Remove trash and other refuse. Dust equipment, furniture, or fixtures. Clean lavatories, showers, and restrooms. Distribute facility supplies and provide other minor maintenance services. Ship, receive, store, or move materials within a warehouse, loading dock, factory, and yard or storage area. Transport materials to and from, or between local company locations, as well as vendors utilized by the Company. Pack finished products for shipment or storage as part of the manufacturing production process. Keep outside grounds clean of debris. Sweep walks, rake leaves, cut grass, and perform other incidental seasonal tasks. Maintain and clean exterior surfaces such as sidewalks and parking areas utilizing power blowers and pressure washers, and manual cleaning/maintenance equipment. Pressure wash terminal equipment. Load and unload spare parts and cores. Pickup and deliver material, spare parts, and cores as needed. Move heavy furniture, equipment, and supplies, either manually or by using hand trucks. Perform minor routine maintenance on facility equipment. Notify managers concerning the need for major repairs or additions to building operating systems. Requisition supplies and equipment needed for cleaning and maintenance duties Perform routine landscape maintenance tasks, utilizing mowing, edging, and other tools. Assist other employees when needed. We offer a comprehensive benefits package to our employees and their families, which includes health, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance, 401K, vacation, and paid holidays. TICO is a Drug-Free Workplace. To learn more about TICO, visit our website at www.ticotractors.com. | Quick Apply

AHEDD is seeking a full-time Employment Specialist in Altoona, PA to support persons with disabilities in finding and maintaining employment in a multi-county area. If you’re a creative thinker with an entrepreneurial commitment to success and a desire to empower the greater community, please consider joining our team! Compensation starts at $28,080 annually, plus the potential for quarterly, performance-based incentives. For more about AHEDD, please see www.ahedd.org. AHEDD is an Equal Opportunity Employer with a commitment to excellence! Position Summary: At NAVEX Global, we create better workplaces by combining innovative people and industry-leading technology that allow companies to build and promote ethical cultures. If you are passionate about numbers and transforming data into a visual story of our business performance, our Data Analyst is the role for you! You will be responsible for interpreting, analyzing and transforming data into a variety of reporting formats to support the goals and key objectives of the Customer Success Organization. You will conduct full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, documentation and design, and provide process improvement opportunities that drive timely and accurate analytic reporting. We Offer You: An innovative organization that is secure, growing and thriving with a reputation that we are proud to say is absolutely second to none A workplace experience that is inclusive and based on our determination to retain you each day as well as enables you to learn, grow and develop your career, and people dedicated to your success at every level Competitive pay with benefits that matter, including the time and flexibility to balance the multiple roles you play in life What You Will Do: Ensure the accuracy, consistency and integrity of reports through timely completion and per standard operating procedures Manage and organize the report library Proactively manage, develop and streamline reporting processes to add efficiencies without sacrificing quality for specific requests, monthly/quarterly reporting and ad-hoc reporting needs Create and maintain performance metrics dashboard and reports across the Services team and for presentation at all levels of the organization Create, maintain and enhance data visualization components in NAVEX Global’s CRM to easily interpret data (dashboards, scorecards) Analyze, interpret and transform data captured to identify key themes and trends Employ analytical techniques to estimate and model the relationships between specific data points and key metrics Perform root cause analysis recommendations to correct data defects What You Will Need: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience Minimum 12 months experience in a data analytics role Critical thinking and an affinity for problem solving with high attention to detail Experience cleaning and manipulating large data sets to identify insights Ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate information with accuracy and translate business requirements into clear and accessible reporting Knowledge of statistics and experience with reporting packages and tools; MS Excel, Salesforce and SQL database preferred Ability to prioritize and organize multiple projects simultaneously and work within fixed deadlines NAVEX Global is an equal opportunity employer, including disability/vets. If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us! Job Type: Full-time Pay: $0.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Disability insurance Employee assistance program Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Referral program Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday COVID-19 considerations: Our teams are working remote through June 2021, at minimum. Experience: Data analytics: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location This Company Describes Its Culture as: Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture People-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focused Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative Company's website: https://www.navexglobal.com/en-us Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/NAVEXGlobal Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19
html_job_description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

Position Summary:

At NAVEX Global, we create better workplaces by combining innovative people and industry-leading technology that allow companies to build and promote ethical cultures.

If you are passionate about numbers and transforming data into a visual story of our business performance, our Data Analyst is the role for you! You will be responsible for interpreting, analyzing and transforming data into a variety of reporting formats to support the goals and key objectives of the Customer Success Organization. You will conduct full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, documentation and design, and provide process improvement opportunities that drive timely and accurate analytic reporting.

We Offer You:

  • An innovative organization that is secure, growing and thriving with a reputation that we are proud to say is absolutely second to none
  • A workplace experience that is inclusive and based on our determination to retain you each day as well as enables you to learn, grow and develop your career, and people dedicated to your success at every level
  • Competitive pay with benefits that matter, including the time and flexibility to balance the multiple roles you play in life

What You Will Do:

  • Ensure the accuracy, consistency and integrity of reports through timely completion and per standard operating procedures
  • Manage and organize the report library
  • Proactively manage, develop and streamline reporting processes to add efficiencies without sacrificing quality for specific requests, monthly/quarterly reporting and ad-hoc reporting needs
  • Create and maintain performance metrics dashboard and reports across the Services team and for presentation at all levels of the organization
  • Create, maintain and enhance data visualization components in NAVEX Global’s CRM to easily interpret data (dashboards, scorecards)
  • Analyze, interpret and transform data captured to identify key themes and trends
  • Employ analytical techniques to estimate and model the relationships between specific data points and key metrics
  • Perform root cause analysis recommendations to correct data defects

What You Will Need:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience
  • Minimum 12 months experience in a data analytics role
  • Critical thinking and an affinity for problem solving with high attention to detail
  • Experience cleaning and manipulating large data sets to identify insights
  • Ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate information with accuracy and translate business requirements into clear and accessible reporting
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience with reporting packages and tools; MS Excel, Salesforce and SQL database preferred
  • Ability to prioritize and organize multiple projects simultaneously and work within fixed deadlines

NAVEX Global is an equal opportunity employer, including disability/vets.

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $0.00 per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Flexible schedule
  • Flexible spending account
  • Health insurance
  • Health savings account
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Parental leave
  • Referral program
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Our teams are working remote through June 2021, at minimum.

Experience:

  • Data analytics: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • One location

This Company Describes Its Culture as:

  • Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture
  • People-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focused
  • Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative

Company's website:

  • https://www.navexglobal.com/en-us

Company's Facebook page:

  • https://www.facebook.com/NAVEXGlobal

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

job_description: 4.3| ||Part-time|2 hours ago| Full Job Description We are looking for a nanny to watch our 1-year-old on Mondays and Tuesdays in our home for the next few months. Starting in January. I work from home so will be here most of the time.

4.3| ||Part-time|2 hours ago| Full Job Description Baby sit our wonderful 1 year old while parents are home. We are looking for extra support while we both work from home and she isn't with her grandparents.

4.3| ||Full-time|2 hours ago| Full Job Description My husband and I now both work fulltime, as I get back in the swing of being a once SAHM to a work from home momma. (I have an office which I will have the door closed). This opportunity will be a big blessing, as we want to keep our little one at home but need someone to watch him. We do have 2 dogs and and cat, but they do stay outside, the only requirement is feeding them. But besides that, your full attention will be on our little blue eyed baby boy ️ he’s the sweetest thing and loves to smile. We are trying to teach him ASL along with Spanish (my mother tongue). So in the morning he will get a few minutes with some background baby cartoons in Spanish. But when we talk to him, we often times do small signs like milk, playtime, more, or etc. So he can start to correlate the sign and English words! We would love to meet up with you, and further discuss his schedule, details, and let you meet our baby boy to see if you are a good match! Hope to see you soon!

4.3| ||Full-time|3 hours ago| Full Job Description Seeking a fun and loving full time nanny for our almost-3-year-old son. Our ideal caregiver would lead active play, enjoy the outdoors, love to read and talk to our son, and enjoy the occasional craft or toddler science experiment to help him learn and grow. Light tidying up after our son, assistance with his laundry, and light breakfast, lunch, and snack prep would be part of your responsibilities. We work from home, so are accessible to you when needed, but will mostly be out of your way. We do have a dog and cat, so please consider that when applying. We also need you to be up to date on vaccinations and flu shots, and take COVID seriously, including a small and safe social bubble, wearing a mask outside, and following all precautions. We are due with our 2nd child soon, so there is potential for this role to expand around May.

4.3| ||Part-time|3 hours ago| Full Job Description I'm looking for someone to come into our home and care for our son. This means playing and reading to with him, feeding and changing him. He is a chill toddler who loves music and balls. Have to be comfortable ignoring a small dog who is suspicious of strangers and comfortable having parents in home. We both work from home and have practiced strict social distancing since the pandemic began. We are looking for some holiday related care and hoping to identify someone we can work with in the future. One thing you should be aware of, our son is a big kid. Thankfully he is walking and running around so you dont need to constantly carry him around. We ask that you take your temperate when you arrive and we will do the same daily. Rate depends on experience.

Appraisal Coordinator

  • Organize completed files after completion for further internal review.

  • Perform updates/verifications (calling and emailing appraisers and customers) on appraisal orders.
  • Learn and comply with industry rules and regulations.
  • Grow and maintain strong working relationships with branches and appraisers.
  • Perform other responsibilities as directed by your supervisor or other executive management as needed.

  • Strong customer service skills
  • Strong computer skills
  • Appraisal experience a plus
  • Collaborative
  • Sense of urgency
  • Accuracy
  • Relationship management
  • Strong communication skills

Hi - we're Topaz Labs. We create AI-powered desktop software that solves photographers' biggest problems: think one-click noise reduction, super-simple masking, and pixel-perfect image upscaling. Our products are used by tens of thousands of paid customers every day, ranging from amateur photographers to major Hollywood movie studios. We're looking for a Product Engineer to lead implementation for one of our core products. In this high-impact role, you'll work with R&D and design to build an exceptional user experience for our customers. You won't just own a small feature here - you'll lead implementation on a complete product for an obsessive customer base. Core responsibilities Own the implementation of the user experience and new features for our core photography products Work closely with Design to create a beautiful and functional product Become an expert in one or more technical AORs (plugins, third party libraries, deployment, testing, QA, etc) This is a mid-level role for someone interested in a working with a high degree of impact and autonomy. The top "soft skills" we're looking for in this role are shipping mentality and work ethic, followed by grit and intellectual humility. As a product engineer, the core competencies of this role are good engineering sense (problem decomposition, architecture, and best practices) and good product sense (user empathy, UX, and UI). We use QML and C++ to develop our apps. You do not need to be proficient in either to excel in this role, as long as you are willing to do what it takes to learn fast. Experience with JS frontend frameworks like React may be helpful, and experience with image/video processing is a huge plus. We’re a small but mighty team of 17 experts in our respective fields from all over the world that have found a place to band together to do remarkable things. Come join us if you’re looking for creative autonomy and massive growth opportunity with a rapidly growing company. We’re also proud to offer performance bonus + profit sharing programs, 100% employee healthcare coverage, 15 days annual PTO, paid holidays, and 401k matching. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $100,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Disability insurance Employee discount Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Paid time off Parental leave Referral program Relocation assistance Retirement plan Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay COVID-19 considerations: Currently we are working from home until COVID-19 is dealt with Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: coding: 1 year (Preferred) This Company Describes Its Culture as: Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focused Innovative -- innovative and risk-taking Aggressive -- competitive and growth-oriented Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture Stable -- traditional, stable, strong processes People-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focused Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative Company's website: https://topazlabs.com/ Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19
html_job_description:
Hi - we're Topaz Labs. We create AI-powered desktop software that solves photographers' biggest problems: think one-click noise reduction, super-simple masking, and pixel-perfect image upscaling. Our products are used by tens of thousands of paid customers every day, ranging from amateur photographers to major Hollywood movie studios.

We're looking for a Product Engineer to lead implementation for one of our core products. In this high-impact role, you'll work with R&D and design to build an exceptional user experience for our customers. You won't just own a small feature here - you'll lead implementation on a complete product for an obsessive customer base.

Core responsibilities

  • Own the implementation of the user experience and new features for our core photography products
  • Work closely with Design to create a beautiful and functional product
  • Become an expert in one or more technical AORs (plugins, third party libraries, deployment, testing, QA, etc)

This is a mid-level role for someone interested in a working with a high degree of impact and autonomy. The top "soft skills" we're looking for in this role are shipping mentality and work ethic, followed by grit and intellectual humility. As a product engineer, the core competencies of this role are good engineering sense (problem decomposition, architecture, and best practices) and good product sense (user empathy, UX, and UI).

We use QML and C++ to develop our apps. You do not need to be proficient in either to excel in this role, as long as you are willing to do what it takes to learn fast. Experience with JS frontend frameworks like React may be helpful, and experience with image/video processing is a huge plus.

We’re a small but mighty team of 17 experts in our respective fields from all over the world that have found a place to band together to do remarkable things. Come join us if you’re looking for creative autonomy and massive growth opportunity with a rapidly growing company. We’re also proud to offer performance bonus + profit sharing programs, 100% employee healthcare coverage, 15 days annual PTO, paid holidays, and 401k matching.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee discount
  • Flexible schedule
  • Flexible spending account
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Parental leave
  • Referral program
  • Relocation assistance
  • Retirement plan
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

  • Bonus pay

COVID-19 considerations:
Currently we are working from home until COVID-19 is dealt with

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

  • coding: 1 year (Preferred)

This Company Describes Its Culture as:

  • Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focused
  • Innovative -- innovative and risk-taking
  • Aggressive -- competitive and growth-oriented
  • Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture
  • Stable -- traditional, stable, strong processes
  • People-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focused
  • Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative

Company's website:

  • https://topazlabs.com/

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19
