job_title: Entry Level Business Development Trainee – Traveling
job_description: 3.2| ||Full-time|1 hour ago| Full Job Description Reynolds and Reynolds is seeking motivated and hard-working Entry Level Business Development Trainees to join our growing team. As an Entry Level Business Development Trainee, you will enroll in our 12 month training program. This program is comprised of both field based and classroom style training. The classroom training is located at our award winning Reynolds University in Dayton, OH. Every month you will travel to Dayton for 1-2 weeks of courses covering a variety of topics, including dealership operations, sales techniques, and negotiation skills. When you are not in Dayton, you will be working with your assigned Sales Mentor in the field, observing the sales process and assisting them on their calls. You will also be given the opportunity to travel with our customer service and installation teams to enhance your knowledge of our products. During the 12 months of training, you can expect to travel up to 75% of the time. Once you complete the training program, you will relocate to your assigned territory and become a Sales Professional. Relocation assistance to this new territory will be provided by the company. In this role you will be responsible for achieving designated monthly and annual quotas by selling Reynolds software products and services to new and existing customers. As a Sales Professional (and Trainee) you will have a home office and will be provided a company car, laptop, iPhone, and other office equipment. Requirements: Ability to build strong customer relationships Bachelor’s degree Excellent oral and written communication skills Must be a self-starter with good time management skills Willing to relocate after successful completion of the 12 month training program

job_title: Outside Sales Real Estate Commission Only
job_description: Quick Apply |Full-time|22 hours ago| Full Job Description If you are a TOP SALES PERFORMER and are ready for an exciting career change, then this is the opportunity that you have been waiting for! Our company is rapidly expanding and is looking forward to hearing from you. Are you a bold, resourceful person who can get to the heart of the matter and influence people to make decisions? We have an unbelievable opportunity for an assertive, goal-oriented person who can build rapport quickly and does not get intimidated easily. Do you want to be in control of your financial future? This role is tailor-made for a true sales closer! 100% commission allows great sales reps to earn over $40,000 and incredible sales reps can exceed $100,000. You have to be a decisive, forward thinker who can manage your time and follow up with leads, as we will not micromanage you. If you love to hunt, the thrill of the close, and have the ability to follow our process, we are looking for you! You do not need to have real estate sales experience or be licensed. This position will involve speaking on the phone and meeting with sellers at their homes. We will provide marketing and leads…You just show up and CLOSE! Job Type: Commission Job Type: Full-time Pay: $40,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year Schedule: Monday to Friday Weekends Supplemental Pay: Commission pay Experience: Sales: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: Multiple locations Paid Training: Yes Company's website: https://atlashomestulsa.com/ Work Remotely: Yes | Quick Apply

Mill Corporation Logistics Accounts Receivable/Invoicing Specialist – Philadelphia, PA Job Summary The Invoicing Specialist is primarily responsible for managing accounts receivables, posting settlements, and billing customers in an efficient manor Primary Job Responsibilities Ability to learn new accounting system Process accounts receivable and settlements in compliance with financial policies and procedures Generate invoices and account statements Perform account reconciliations Maintain accounts receivable files and records Produce monthly financial reports Investigate and resolve any discrepancies, irregularities, or enquiries Assist in general financial management and analysis Communicate with customers to request and arrange payments Record and track payments in databases Update customer accounts based on payment or contact information Prepare and send customer invoices Maintain carrier factoring companies Reconcile the accounts receivable ledger to ensure that all payments are accounted for and properly posted Qualifications and Requirements Strong organizational skills with ability to multi task and prioritize deadlines in a fast-paced environment Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office, particularly Excel Proven experience in a role with strong emphasis on verbal and written communication and negotiation skills Data entry skills and a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail Previous work experience in administration, accounts receivable, account reconciliations, or other relevant environment preferred Hours 8am-5pm, flexibility for additional hours as work dictates Employee Benefits We offer a very competitive base salary, negotiable based on qualifications and experience Annual vacation days and paid holidays Standard company benefits, health insurance, and retirement programs Job Type: Full-time Pay: $15.00 - $30.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: One location Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19
html_job_description:
Mill Corporation

Logistics Accounts Receivable/Invoicing Specialist – Philadelphia, PA

Job Summary

The Invoicing Specialist is primarily responsible for managing accounts receivables, posting settlements, and billing customers in an efficient manor

Primary Job Responsibilities

  • Ability to learn new accounting system
  • Process accounts receivable and settlements in compliance with financial policies and procedures
  • Generate invoices and account statements
  • Perform account reconciliations
  • Maintain accounts receivable files and records
  • Produce monthly financial reports
  • Investigate and resolve any discrepancies, irregularities, or enquiries
  • Assist in general financial management and analysis
  • Communicate with customers to request and arrange payments
  • Record and track payments in databases
  • Update customer accounts based on payment or contact information
  • Prepare and send customer invoices
  • Maintain carrier factoring companies
  • Reconcile the accounts receivable ledger to ensure that all payments are accounted for and properly posted

Qualifications and Requirements

  • Strong organizational skills with ability to multi task and prioritize deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office, particularly Excel
  • Proven experience in a role with strong emphasis on verbal and written communication and negotiation skills
  • Data entry skills and a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Previous work experience in administration, accounts receivable, account reconciliations, or other relevant environment preferred
  • Hours 8am-5pm, flexibility for additional hours as work dictates

Employee Benefits

  • We offer a very competitive base salary, negotiable based on qualifications and experience
  • Annual vacation days and paid holidays
  • Standard company benefits, health insurance, and retirement programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $15.00 - $30.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

3.8| ||Part-time|12 hours ago| Full Job Description Company Overview: WW is looking for candidates to help change people’s lives. We are a global wellness technology company inspiring millions of people to adopt healthy habits for real life. We do this through engaging digital experiences, face-to-face workshops and sustainable programs that encourage people to move more, shift their mindset and eat healthier while enjoying the foods they love. By drawing on over five decades of experience and expertise in behavioral science, we build communities in order to deliver wellness for all. To learn more about WW and jobs with a purpose, visit ww.com. Role Overview: A WW Studio Guide channels a passion for a healthy lifestyle into inspiring others at every step of their wellness and weight loss journeys. A WW Studio Guide aids new member recruitment and current member retention efforts. Our Guides assist in helping members develop healthy habits by eating healthier, while still enjoying foods they love, moving more, sleeping better, and shifting their mindset. The WW Studio Guide is responsible for personalizing individual welln Deliver An Exceptional Studio Experience by: Creating a welcoming environment for members and conducting Wellness Check-Ins. Enrolling and processing members in the WW system and completing cashless sales transactions. Establishing rapport with members and showing empathy during one-on-one interactions, actively listening and questioning. Creating a safe, engaging, and personalized experience for each member. Serving as an expert in WW’s scientifically proven methodology for building healthy habits, weight loss and holistic wellness. Bringing your own personal energy to the Studio and sharing expertise of WW digital tools and offerings. Build Strong Connections In the Community by: Actively seeking opportunities to build on-brand partnerships, attract new members, and create brand awareness, representing WW at internal and external community events. Focus on Member Recruitment and Retention by: Developing personal connections with our members and providing them support and encouraging them to return to the studio. Identifying our members’ needs and recommending the right WW products or services. Other Duties Ensure PPE guidelines are followed for each workshop. Stock shelves with consumer products for purchase. Requirements: Passion for wellness and healthy lifestyle, and supporting others to achieve wellness and weight loss goals, leads by example. Passion for WW brand (current WW members preferred). Empathetic and comfortable building rapport with our members. Excellent at active listening and able to connect members to the WW products. Social media and tech savvy. Retail sales or customer service experience preferred. Comfortable to work independently. Ability to complete some of your work at home (i.e. workshop prep, reading emails, etc.). Able to travel to our workshop locations (up to 25-mile radius preferred). Available to work a flexible schedule, with a minimum requirement of 3 Studio Workshops each week. Able to lift 25 pounds. Places high value on encouraging sustainable, science-backed approaches to wellness. Can separate facts from fads. Excellent reading comprehension and verbal and written communication skills. Strong active listening skills. Computer skills (G Suite, web-based applications). WW is an equal opportunity employer. WW does not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, creed, national origin, marital status, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

job_description: 3.8| ||Full-time|1 hour ago| Full Job Description Company Overview iboss is a cloud security company that provides organizations and their employees secure access to the Internet on any device, from any location, in the cloud. This eliminates the need for traditional security appliances, which are ineffective at protecting a cloud-first and mobile world. Leveraging a purpose-built cloud architecture backed by over 190 issued and pending patents and more than 100 points of presence globally, iboss protects more than 4,000 organizations worldwide. The Company is headquartered in Boston, MA, and has operations in Orlando, San Diego, London, and the Philippines. At iboss, we believe that exceptional employees are the key to our success. Our teams are small, diverse, nimble and highly empowered to drive excellence. Come be a part of the team that will transform the way cybersecurity is delivered! Job Description The Linux System Administrator at iboss is responsible for handling the support Infrastructure, operating systems, virtual platforms, and applications. The administrator is responsible for the integrity and security of the servers and computer systems by following established security protocols and practices. Responsibilities Managing and maintaining iboss monitoring systems, ensuring the systems are updated with changing technologies. Primary responsibility for setup, installation, integration, monitoring, documentation, and maintenance of all Linux-based systems in a centralized IT environment Responding to system and/or network faults to ensure internal and external SLAs are met Following escalation procedures to engage key resources to respond to critical events Working with internal stake holders (DevOps, support, sales) and 3rd party vendors to schedule maintenance. Provide escalation-level technical support and system engineering for all Linux-based platforms Work with team members to perform regular system audit and security reviews, including evaluation, implementation, and management of best practices in computer security Create and maintain documentation related to global points of presence and procedures Qualifications Strong Linux background (RHEL, CentOS, Debian, etc.) Proficient / Fluent written and verbal communication in English Strong diagnostic/troubleshooting skill set Ability to assess and prioritize incidents quickly while under pressure Basic understanding of the OSI model and internetworking Bachelor’s Degree or working towards a bachelor’s degree Capability to multitask in multiple environments Benefits Health, Vision, Dental- open to domestic partners 401K with company match Paid Time Off (PTO) Company paid holidays Optimistic, supportive, and FUN work environment Fantastic quarterly company events Free catered lunch every Friday Free snacks Free on-site gym membership The duties and responsibilities described above are essential functions of the job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran or as an individual with a disability. This position is not eligible for sponsorship of work visas

NOW HIRING FOR THE NEW YEAR!! We are looking for a professional, seasoned sales representative to help grow our already successful business. You will be selling advertising space on products which will be distributed by Harris Teeter, successful local independent pharmacies, and other reputable grocery and pharmacy chains. This is a low/no pressure sale with quick closes. You will be working from your home office. We are a proven, 30+ year old business and are looking for those with the mindset that with change comes opportunity. Salary is $50,000 - $75,000 per year depending on drive, experience and persistence. Commissions are paid very quickly. Requirements: AT LEAST 1 year of sales, preferably more, and preferably in advertising sales. A home office already setup with at least a laptop or desktop computer, internet, cell phone or landline phone, and a distraction-free environment. The ability to make 75-100 outbound calls per day without any issues. You must be willing to come to Wilmington, NC for a 1 day training session if asked (not all will be asked to come). Able to work in the U.S. Please only apply if you meet these requirements and also let us know if you are planning on moving to Wilmington NC in the near future. Candidates will be contacted directly if we are interested. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $50,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Remotely: Yes

job_description: hear.com is the fastest growing hearing aid company in the world. We believe that everyone should hear well to live well. With our unique digitalized business model, we've changed the way hearing aids are delivered. Every day our team helps customers improve their quality of life through better hearing - since the start in 2012 that’s over 200,000 clients. We work hard, and we also have a lot of fun and exceptional times, in our 11 international offices, from Denver to Seoul. We sell the world’s best hearing devices – as simple as that. What started as a small dream in an apartment in Berlin, Germany, in 2012 has grown into a global phenomenon with over 1,000 team members! We operate in 11 countries and are the online No 1 in each one of them – making us the world leader in online hearing care. Why hear.com? · A global company with a long term vision and strong growth · Warm Leads, No Cold Calling · $33,000 base salary + uncapped high commission · Work from Home Office (Remote) · Comprehensive Virtual Training · Full Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits and option for 401K During a typical day, you will... · Provide our customers with detailed phone consultations · Develop individual solutions based on the hearing needs of our customer · Provide knowledge and in-depth advice for hearing loss and hearing aids · Schedule appointments with customers and our partner providers. · Support our customers during their 45 day trial until they are 100% happy with their devices You are... · A driven sales professional with a proven track record of success · Emotionally intelligent and communicate with empathy · Have tons of energy, compassion, humor, and enthusiasm You have… · Strong sales skills over the phone · Powerful work ethics and a Growth Mindset · A college degree · Over the phone sales experience Job Type: Full-time Pay: $50,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Weekends Supplemental Pay: Commission pay Experience: Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)

hear.com is the fastest growing hearing aid company in the world. We believe that everyone should hear well to live well. With our unique digitalized business model, we've changed the way hearing aids are delivered. We work hard, and we also have a lot of fun and exceptional times, in our 11 international offices, from Denver to Seoul.

We sell the world’s best hearing devices – as simple as that. What started as a small dream in an apartment in Berlin, Germany, in 2012 has grown into a global phenomenon with over 1,000 team members! · A global company with a long term vision and strong growth

· Warm Leads, No Cold Calling

· $33,000 base salary + uncapped high commission

· Comprehensive Virtual Training

· Full Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits and option for 401K

· Develop individual solutions based on the hearing needs of our customer

· Provide knowledge and in-depth advice for hearing loss and hearing aids

· Schedule appointments with customers and our partner providers.

· Support our customers during their 45 day trial until they are 100% happy with their devices

You are...

· A driven sales professional with a proven track record of success

· Emotionally intelligent and communicate with empathy

· Have tons of energy, compassion, humor, and enthusiasm

You have…

· Strong sales skills over the phone

· Powerful work ethics and a Growth Mindset

· Over the phone sales experience

job_description: If you are a TOP SALES PERFORMER and are ready for an exciting career change, then this is the opportunity that you have been waiting for! Our company is rapidly expanding and is looking forward to hearing from you. Are you a bold, resourceful person who can get to the heart of the matter and influence people to make decisions? We have an unbelievable opportunity for an assertive, goal-oriented person who can build rapport quickly and does not get intimidated easily. Do you want to be in control of your financial future? This role is tailor-made for a true sales closer! 100% commission allows great sales reps to earn over $40,000 and incredible sales reps can exceed $100,000. You have to be a decisive, forward thinker who can manage your time and follow up with leads, as we will not micromanage you. If you love to hunt, the thrill of the close, and have the ability to follow our process, we are looking for you! You do not need to have real estate sales experience or be licensed. This position will involve speaking on the phone and meeting with sellers at their homes. We will provide marketing and leads…You just show up and CLOSE! Provide escalation-level technical support and system engineering for all Linux-based platforms Work with team members to perform regular system audit and security reviews, including evaluation, implementation, and management of best practices in computer security Create and maintain documentation related to global points of presence and procedures Qualifications Strong Linux background (RHEL, CentOS, Debian, etc.) Proficient / Fluent written and verbal communication in English Strong diagnostic/troubleshooting skill set Ability to assess and prioritize incidents quickly while under pressure Basic understanding of the OSI model and internetworking Bachelor’s Degree or working towards a bachelor’s degree Capability to multitask in multiple environments Benefits Health, Vision, Dental- open to domestic partners 401K with company match Paid Time Off (PTO) Company paid holidays Optimistic, supportive, and FUN work environment Fantastic quarterly company events Free catered lunch every Friday Free snacks Free on-site gym membership The duties and responsibilities described above are essential functions of the job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran or as an individual with a disability. This position is not eligible for sponsorship of work visas

Quick Apply |Part-time|3 hours ago| Full Job Description Come be a part of the MyShoplift team! We are looking for customer service-oriented people who thrive in a fast-paced, high energy environment. What is MyShoplift? We are every shopper's one-tap app for the #1 on-demand delivery service. We are looking for highly motivated, reliable, and passionate service-minded individuals to join our team of call center representatives. What does a call center representative do? The typical call center representative values our customers and is a skilled problem solver. They are able to quickly diffuse situations, troubleshoot issues, and search for win-win solutions. Our call center representatives will take inbound calls from customers and MyShoplift drivers and make outbound calls when needed for follow up. With every interaction, our call center representatives are expected to meet exceptional service standards, respond efficiently to customer inquiries, and maintain high customer satisfaction. Call Center Representative responsibilities include: - Manage incoming calls - Listen to customers, understand their needs, and resolve customers' needs - Provide accurate and complete information - Ensure first call resolution through problem-solving and effective call handling - Follow communication procedures, guidelines, and policies - Meet call quality expectations Skills - Proven customer service experience - Solid problem-solving skills and attention to detail - Excellent communication skills - Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively -Spanish Speaking Job Type: Part-Time Call Center Hours of Operation: Vary Pay: $12.00/hr Experience: - Call Center: 1 year (preferred) - Customer Service: 1 year (preferred) - Bilingual (preferred) Education: - High School or equivalent Work Location: Remote *Must meet minimum system requirements to work remotely MyShoplift is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job Type: Part-time Pay: $12.00 per hour Job Type: Part-time Pay: $12.00 per hour Benefits: Paid time off COVID-19 considerations: This position is fully remote Experience: Call center: 1 year (Preferred) Customer service: 1 year (Preferred) Language: Spanish (Preferred) Work Location: Fully Remote Communication method(s) used: Email Phone Chat This Job Is: A job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to apply Open to applicants who do not have a college diploma COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process | Quick Apply

4.0| ||Full-time|2 hours ago| Full Job Description At Veeva, we build enterprise cloud technology that powers the biggest names in the pharmaceutical, biotech, consumer goods, chemical & cosmetics industries. Our customers make vaccines, life-saving medicines, and life-enhancing products that make a difference in everyday lives. Our technology has transformed these industries; enabling them to get critical products and services to market faster. Our core values, Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed, guide us as we make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. The Role The remote Data Steward is responsible for manually verifying and updating data records to improve core data by using standard methods of research. The Data Steward will identify the elements which they will steward, with the ultimate results being standards, controls, and data entry. This junior-level role requires English-language fluency as well as a work environment that is conducive for remote work. What You'll Do Research the Internet in the healthcare domain Place outbound calls to healthcare practitioners and organizations Apply newly-verified data elements to database records in a software system Provide updates to and maintain Healthcare providers (HCP’s) and Healthcare Organizations (HCO’s) data Remove incorrect data elements and database records from the core database Meet and maintain daily performance goals Requirements Remote call center or customer service experience Ability to work independently, and manage rigorous daily deadlines Highly organized, attention to detail and focus on quality Strong data entry skills Ability to learn quickly and exhibit strong problem-solving skills Proficiency in Windows, Internet-based research, Google Apps, MS Office, and other office software Experience working within healthcare, customer data, life science industries, or market research Have an environment that can accommodate remote work needs e.g.: quiet, well-lit, a surface that can support a computer and monitor Nice to Have Basic technical computer skills: Excel and PPT proficiency. SQL knowledge is a plus. #LI-Remote Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. Veeva is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

job_description: Description Robert Half Technology is hiring several ServiceNow Implementation Experts for a Software Provider that specializes in DevOps Software Tools within a NOC. These positions are 100% remote and can be located anywhere in the US. Expertise in ServiceNow, ITSM, and Python are desired. The candidate will be the ServiceNow Subject Matter expert responsible for the development of a complete enterprise solution for large managed services contracts with specific Service Level Agreements. These are Business Grade/Carrier Grade retail and whole services like AVPN, MIS (Internet Pipe), BVoIP, Layer2 Transport, Private Lines, Mobility Backhaul, etc. Create requirements definitions and technical specifications documentation plus load, manipulate and maintain data between Service-now and other systems. This requires high level of proficiency in CMDB, Workflow Designer, Service Now Studio, knowledge of telecom operations model. The candidate will Configure/Customize the ServiceNow system, including creating workflows, build service requests from customer requirements, request items and tasks using workflows to manage data flows from the customer to the support teams providing the service, use scripting tools and ServiceNow functionality to create script to automate rote tasks being done in ServiceNow, perform integrations and process automation using ServiceNow Orchestration, gather specifications from the IT department and deliver a product/release that meets the needs presented. Create requirements definitions and technical specifications documentation plus load, manipulate and maintain data between Service-now and other systems. The candidate will work with IT managers to generate views and reports as needed, analyze and fully understand user requirements and current procedures in order to improve system capabilities, automate process workflows and address scheduling limitations throughout the development and delivery of the ServiceNow roadmap, be competent with ITIL/ITSM processes, perform system and integration testing with sample and live data, monitor health, usage and overall compliance of the application, plus detailed knowledge in CSS and other web technologies. The candidate will assess existing ServiceNow usage and recommend forward evolution of ServiceNow capabilities to maximize their use within the development environment. Strong background in ITIL, Agile development, requirements definition, and systems development in a US Telecom Carrier preferable. Requirements ServiceNow ServiceNow ITSM Lamba Python Amazon Web Services (AWS) Robert Half Technology matches IT professionals with remote or on-site jobs on a temporary, project or full-time basis. html_job_description:
Description

Robert Half Technology is hiring several ServiceNow Implementation Experts for a Software Provider that specializes in DevOps Software Tools within a NOC. These positions are 100% remote and can be located anywhere in the US. Expertise in ServiceNow, ITSM, and Python are desired. The candidate will be the ServiceNow Subject Matter expert responsible for the development of a complete enterprise solution for large managed services contracts with specific Service Level Agreements. These are Business Grade/Carrier Grade retail and whole services like AVPN, MIS (Internet Pipe), BVoIP, Layer2 Transport, Private Lines, Mobility Backhaul, etc. Create requirements definitions and technical specifications documentation plus load, manipulate and maintain data between Service-now and other systems. This requires high level of proficiency in CMDB, Workflow Designer, Service Now Studio, knowledge of telecom operations model. The candidate will Configure/Customize the ServiceNow system, including creating workflows, build service requests from customer requirements, request items and tasks using workflows to manage data flows from the customer to the support teams providing the service, use scripting tools and ServiceNow functionality to create script to automate rote tasks being done in ServiceNow, perform integrations and process automation using ServiceNow Orchestration, gather specifications from the IT department and deliver a product/release that meets the needs presented. Create requirements definitions and technical specifications documentation plus load, manipulate and maintain data between Service-now and other systems. The candidate will work with IT managers to generate views and reports as needed, analyze and fully understand user requirements and current procedures in order to improve system capabilities, automate process workflows and address scheduling limitations throughout the development and delivery of the ServiceNow roadmap, be competent with ITIL/ITSM processes, perform system and integration testing with sample and live data, monitor health, usage and overall compliance of the application, plus detailed knowledge in CSS and other web technologies. The candidate will assess existing ServiceNow usage and recommend forward evolution of ServiceNow capabilities to maximize their use within the development environment. Strong background in ITIL, Agile development, requirements definition, and systems development in a US Telecom Carrier preferable.

Requirements

ServiceNow ServiceNow ITSM Lamba Python Amazon Web Services (AWS)

If you’re both an animal lover and a people person, a position in one of our stores might be a great fit. We’re looking for people with a strong commitment to helping pets and their parents experience their very best lives together. When you join us, you’ll be part of a great team, working together to achieve sales goals while doing work you truly love. Position Purpose: Responsible for the efficient execution of merchandising items to ensure with consistency in product sets and signage displays across a group of stores. Accountable for a reduction in time spent on merchandising processes due to an increased familiarity of sets. Essential Job Functions:   Through previous background and experience the candidate must demonstrate, with or without an accommodation, the ability to... Interact professionally and effectively through verbal and written communication with all professional contacts with emphasis on company interests Good knowledge of the store product and strong merchandising and organization skills. Ability to be diligent in completion of time keeping, mileage calculations and expenses. Access to reliable transportation, proper liability insurance Move merchandise up to 50 pounds Supervisory Responsibility   None   Work Environment   The nature of the job requires daily travel to various stores, with overnight stay possible for remote locations.  Duties may include bending, stooping, lifting (50 lbs), standing, walking and fixture building.  Associate may be expected to occasionally use a hand-held tool such as a hammer or rubber mallet to perform a task.
html_job_description:
If you’re both an animal lover and a people person, a position in one of our stores might be a great fit. We’re looking for people with a strong commitment to helping pets and their parents experience their very best lives together. When you join us, you’ll be part of a great team, working together to achieve sales goals while doing work you truly love.

Position Purpose:


Responsible for the efficient execution of merchandising items to ensure with consistency in product sets and signage displays across a group of stores. Accountable for a reduction in time spent on merchandising processes due to an increased familiarity of sets.


Essential Job Functions:

 
Through previous background and experience the candidate must demonstrate, with or without an accommodation, the ability to...
  • Interact professionally and effectively through verbal and written communication with all professional contacts with emphasis on company interests
  • Good knowledge of the store product and strong merchandising and organization skills.
  • Ability to be diligent in completion of time keeping, mileage calculations and expenses.
  • Access to reliable transportation, proper liability insurance
  • Move merchandise up to 50 pounds

Supervisory Responsibility

 
None

 

Work Environment

 
The nature of the job requires daily travel to various stores, with overnight stay possible for remote locations.  Duties may include bending, stooping, lifting (50 lbs), standing, walking and fixture building.  Associate may be expected to occasionally use a hand-held tool such as a hammer or rubber mallet to perform a task.

job_title: Entry Level Business Development Trainee – Traveling
job_description: 3.2| ||Full-time|16 hours ago| Full Job Description Reynolds and Reynolds is seeking motivated and hard-working Entry Level Business Development Trainees to join our growing team. As an Entry Level Business Development Trainee, you will enroll in our 12 month training program. This program is comprised of both field based and classroom style training. The classroom training is located at our award winning Reynolds University in Dayton, OH. Every month you will travel to Dayton for 1-2 weeks of courses covering a variety of topics, including dealership operations, sales techniques, and negotiation skills. When you are not in Dayton, you will be working with your assigned Sales Mentor in the field, observing the sales process and assisting them on their calls. You will also be given the opportunity to travel with our customer service and installation teams to enhance your knowledge of our products. During the 12 months of training, you can expect to travel up to 75% of the time. Once you complete the training program, you will relocate to your assigned territory and become a Sales Professional. Relocation assistance to this new territory will be provided by the company. In this role you will be responsible for achieving designated monthly and annual quotas by selling Reynolds software products and services to new and existing customers. As a Sales Professional (and Trainee) you will have a home office and will be provided a company car, laptop, iPhone, and other office equipment. Requirements: Ability to build strong customer relationships Bachelor’s degree Excellent oral and written communication skills Must be a self-starter with good time management skills Willing to relocate after successful completion of the 12 month training program

Description: This position will be supporting testing of printers in lab environment. Daily duties include loading paper into printers, removing copies, documenting and clearing problems, and entering data into PC. Provides input to test engineers on product performance. Testing includes any or all of the following areas: Paper feed reliability, Print/copy quality, Printer robustness testing, Testing of competitive printer products, Sub-system testing, Printhead/cartridge yield testing, Printhead/cartridge reliability testing, Reviewing output for defects. html_job_description:
Are you passionate about helping local businesses through this pandemic?


Do you enjoy not only growing professionally, but personally as well?


Would you want to work with a group of people who become your best friends?


We are seeking proactive, self-motivated, and value-driven individuals. As a representative, you will have the opportunity to provide local businesses with solutions to the problems created in this pandemic. You will be able to equip these businesses with the tools they need to work remotely if need be, while protecting them from scam calls, all while cutting their telecommunication expense by 50 percent. One expectation of our representatives is not only to grow within our company but also to grow personally as well. To help with this we provide our representatives with a library of books, consistent self-development meetings, networking opportunities, a fitness center, and a basketball court. As a representative with us, you will be joining a family, that is our number one core value. As we continue to hit our goal of growing by 100 percent yearly, our main focus is maintaining the culture of a family environment.

Main Duties

  • Oversee 30-60 clients - Our goal is to grow by 100 percent this year as a company
  • Manage and develop a territory - Oversee and help local business develop
  • Presentations to customers- Focus on the problems our products solve for the local businesses
  • Use CRM - Use our client tracking system to maximize effectiveness
  • Team management - Oversee and develop a small sales team
  • Product Knowledge - Understand how we are providing a solution for the local businesses through this pandemic
  • Product development - Use your creativity to help us better our product and continue to get better
  • Sharpen the saw - Equip oneself with the resources to maximize their potential
  • Self-Supervision - No micromanagement, we focus on results, not methods
  • Consistent - We need dependable individuals to achieve our goals
  • Value driven - Maintaining our family environment as we grow
  • Proactive Mentality - Focusing on what we can control; attitude and outlook

Incentives

  • Paid travel
  • Networking with business owners
  • Weekly and monthly bonuses
  • Onsite fitness center
  • Onsite library
  • Onsite kitchen
  • Onsite basketball court
  • Business mobile phone line
  • Sams club premium membership

html_job_description:
Are you passionate about serving local businesses through this pandemic?


Do you enjoy growing professionally and personally?


Would you want to work with a group of people who become your best friends?


We are seeking a enthusiastic, optimistic, and fun loving individual. As a Brand Ambassador you will have the opportunity to provide local businesses with solutions to the problems created in this pandemic. You will be able to equip these businesses with the tools they need to work remotely if need be, while protecting them from scam calls, all while cutting their telecommunication expense by 50 percent. One expectation of our Brand Ambassadors is not only to grow within our company but also to grow personally as well. To help with this we provide our ambassadors with a library of books, consistent self-development meetings, networking opportunities, a fitness center, and a basketball court. As a representative with us, you will be joining a family, that is our number one core value. As we continue to hit our goal of growing by 100 percent yearly, our main focus is maintaining the culture of a family environment.

Responsibilities

  • Meet with 30-60 clients - Our goal is to grow by 100 percent this year as a company
  • Grow territory - Oversee and help local business develop
  • Presentations to customers- Focus on the problems our products solve for the local businesses
  • Customer Relationship Management - Use our client tracking system to maximize effectiveness
  • Be a Leader - Oversee and develop a small sales team
  • Familiarize with product - Understand how we are providing a solution for the local businesses through this pandemic
  • Product development - Use your creativity to help us better our product and continue to get better
  • Self-Development - Equip oneself with the resources to maximize their potential
  • Self-Management - No micromanagement, we focus on results, not methods
  • Honorable - We need dependable individuals to achieve our goals
  • Value driven - Maintaining our family environment as we grow
  • Proactive - Focusing on what we can control; attitude and outlook

Perks:

  • Paid travel
  • Networking with business owners
  • Weekly and monthly bonuses
  • Onsite fitness center
  • Onsite library
  • Onsite kitchen
  • Onsite basketball court
  • Business mobile phone line
  • Sams club premium membership

3.5| || Quick Apply |Full-time|16 hours ago| Full Job Description The Construction Estimator position is primarily responsible for scoping, estimating, selling and managing environmental remediation/cleanup projects, asbestos abatement and demolition/deconstruction work. This includes the coordination and preparation of full estimates for complex soil and earthwork projects, with complete conceptual and total bid pricing. Estimating work includes time and materials, cost reimbursable estimates, lump sum, and unit pricing estimates for projects. Day to day tasks include: Analyze Requests for Proposals (RFP’s), plans, and amendments to determine the scope of work and content to establish costs, preparation time, project schedules, materials, and labor/manpower estimates; review all documentation for competitive bid information and accuracy. Review construction documents, understand the scope of work to bid, and break it down into definable tasks. Prepare cost analysis for materials, labor and manpower equipment, subcontractor, and overhead costs incurred in the installation of items. Develop and maintain resource information related to products, vendors, subcontractors, government requirements, etc. Direct on-site supervision throughout the course of the work to properly execute tasks in the field. Work closely with project managers, owners, and subcontractors to promote the understanding of the scope of work, areas of Risk, changes, potential Requests for Information, and any adjustments to cost estimates prior to proposal submission to formulate accurate estimates that mitigate risk for the organization. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $75,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Work Location: Multiple locations Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: Yes | Quick Apply

job_title: Entry Level Business Development Trainee – Traveling
job_description: 3.2| ||Full-time|16 hours ago| Full Job Description Reynolds and Reynolds is seeking motivated and hard-working Entry Level Business Development Trainees to join our growing team. As an Entry Level Business Development Trainee, you will enroll in our 12 month training program. This program is comprised of both field based and classroom style training. The classroom training is located at our award winning Reynolds University in Dayton, OH. Every month you will travel to Dayton for 1-2 weeks of courses covering a variety of topics, including dealership operations, sales techniques, and negotiation skills. When you are not in Dayton, you will be working with your assigned Sales Mentor in the field, observing the sales process and assisting them on their calls. You will also be given the opportunity to travel with our customer service and installation teams to enhance your knowledge of our products. During the 12 months of training, you can expect to travel up to 75% of the time. Once you complete the training program, you will relocate to your assigned territory and become a Sales Professional. Relocation assistance to this new territory will be provided by the company. In this role you will be responsible for achieving designated monthly and annual quotas by selling Reynolds software products and services to new and existing customers. As a Sales Professional (and Trainee) you will have a home office and will be provided a company car, laptop, iPhone, and other office equipment. Requirements: Ability to build strong customer relationships Bachelor’s degree Excellent oral and written communication skills Must be a self-starter with good time management skills Willing to relocate after successful completion of the 12 month training program

job_description: Gamalon develops AI-driven conversational agents. We’ve created the first chatbot that learns to talk to customers simply, without requiring laborious decision trees or extensively labeled training data. Statistics for our first cohort of customer deployments demonstrate that the Gamalon AI helps customers as well or better than a human chat rep. We’ve seen great success with early customers. We are now heading into rapid expansion. We are looking for an experienced software engineer with startup experience to work on our machine learning team to translate our unique approach and algorithms into well-designed customer facing code. Gamalon’s machine learning bridges the gap between laborious, fully supervised machine learning and powerful but difficult-to-control unsupervised learning. We’re committed to more easily-designed and robust conversational experiences. In most jobs, you work primarily to shepherd black box models; at Gamalon we empower software engineers to work inside the model. That means engaging with the important problems of what a model should learn and how it should behave. Members of our focused research team make impactful decisions about which problems to solve and how to build out these systems in a production environment. Gamalon was recognized by MIT Technology Review as one of the “50 Smartest Companies” for 2017 and by the World Economic Forum as a 2018 Technology Pioneer. We have filed 52 patents. Gamalon’s conversational AI products are based on a technology platform developed from over $35M of DARPA funded R&D in collaboration with Stanford and MIT, and a $20M Series A led by Intel Capital to commercialize the technology. Who You Are You are generous with others and collaborate well in a team environment. You are curious to learn more about advanced machine learning. You have made a measurable impact on a commercial code base, working in a startup or other highly dynamic environment. Strong interest in being part of one of the first teams building AI-first software products, collaborating with machine learning scientists as well as with product design. (AI is not yet as agile as software, so you will need to be prepared to collaborate in new ways). You are a seasoned software architect, and comfortable interacting with the stakeholders for that architecture: the research team and product leads. You can demonstrate a facility for learning new programming languages and frameworks Strong ability to communicate ideas while writing, reviewing, and discussing technical specifications You are proficient in Python and can model good software practices You are based in the Boston area or willing to move. (Gamalon is remote-first due to the COVID-19 pandemic, but we have not made a decision to remain so.) You are authorized to work in the U.S. What You’ll Do You will sit on our product-focused development team, working with machine learning scientists, software engineers, and product leads to develop our IdeaFlow chat product Main responsibility is working collaboratively with the research team to move validated ideas and algorithms through to tested, production code. Frequently pair with research scientists to solve complex problems. Shape architectural choices for how we and our users control our AI Contribute to our generative machine learning testing framework that helps us manage models that constantly change and grow. Solid experience iteratively designing and maintaining codebases for prototyping ideas. Work in an agile environment, rapidly delivering shippable features into production. Salary negotiable. Comprehensive healthcare (including dental and vision), 401k plan and parental leave benefits. You may not feel that you have all of the experience and skills listed above, but if you are very excited about this role, please apply anyway. We have found that people who are passionate to join us are often the people who we are passionate to hire. We have a relatively diverse team at Gamalon, and we have seen first hand that as our team diversity has increased, so has the quality of our ideas, teamwork, and delivery. People become more articulate when they are working within a diversity of viewpoints. We work hard to encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or other characteristics. Job Type: Full-time Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19
salary_offered: Salary negotiable. Comprehensive healthcare (including dental and vision), 401k plan and parental leave benefits.
html_job_description:
Gamalon develops AI-driven conversational agents. We’ve created the first chatbot that learns to talk to customers simply, without requiring laborious decision trees or extensively labeled training data. Statistics for our first cohort of customer deployments demonstrate that the Gamalon AI helps customers as well or better than a human chat rep.

We’ve seen great success with early customers. We are now heading into rapid expansion. We are looking for an experienced software engineer with startup experience to work on our machine learning team to translate our unique approach and algorithms into well-designed customer facing code.

Gamalon’s machine learning bridges the gap between laborious, fully supervised machine learning and powerful but difficult-to-control unsupervised learning. We’re committed to more easily-designed and robust conversational experiences. In most jobs, you work primarily to shepherd black box models; at Gamalon we empower software engineers to work inside the model. That means engaging with the important problems of what a model should learn and how it should behave. Members of our focused research team make impactful decisions about which problems to solve and how to build out these systems in a production environment.

Gamalon was recognized by MIT Technology Review as one of the “50 Smartest Companies” for 2017 and by the World Economic Forum as a 2018 Technology Pioneer. We have filed 52 patents. Gamalon’s conversational AI products are based on a technology platform developed from over $35M of DARPA funded R&D in collaboration with Stanford and MIT, and a $20M Series A led by Intel Capital to commercialize the technology.

Who You Are

  • You are generous with others and collaborate well in a team environment.
  • You are curious to learn more about advanced machine learning.
  • You have made a measurable impact on a commercial code base, working in a startup or other highly dynamic environment.
  • Strong interest in being part of one of the first teams building AI-first software products, collaborating with machine learning scientists as well as with product design. (AI is not yet as agile as software, so you will need to be prepared to collaborate in new ways).
  • You are a seasoned software architect, and comfortable interacting with the stakeholders for that architecture: the research team and product leads.
  • You can demonstrate a facility for learning new programming languages and frameworks
  • Strong ability to communicate ideas while writing, reviewing, and discussing technical specifications
  • You are proficient in Python and can model good software practices
  • You are based in the Boston area or willing to move. (Gamalon is remote-first due to the COVID-19 pandemic, but we have not made a decision to remain so.)
  • You are authorized to work in the U.S.

What You’ll Do

  • You will sit on our product-focused development team, working with machine learning scientists, software engineers, and product leads to develop our IdeaFlow chat product
  • Main responsibility is working collaboratively with the research team to move validated ideas and algorithms through to tested, production code.
  • Frequently pair with research scientists to solve complex problems.
  • Shape architectural choices for how we and our users control our AI
  • Contribute to our generative machine learning testing framework that helps us manage models that constantly change and grow.
  • Solid experience iteratively designing and maintaining codebases for prototyping ideas.
  • Work in an agile environment, rapidly delivering shippable features into production.

Salary negotiable. Comprehensive healthcare (including dental and vision), 401k plan and parental leave benefits.

You may not feel that you have all of the experience and skills listed above, but if you are very excited about this role, please apply anyway. We have found that people who are passionate to join us are often the people who we are passionate to hire.

We have a relatively diverse team at Gamalon, and we have seen first hand that as our team diversity has increased, so has the quality of our ideas, teamwork, and delivery. People become more articulate when they are working within a diversity of viewpoints. We work hard to encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or other characteristics.

Job Type: Full-time

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

job_description: Job Description Our computer technicians play a vital role in providing superior hardware focused field service support to both residential and commercial customers of major PC and printer manufacturers. The best field technicians are independent self-starters who have the drive, technical aptitude, and interpersonal skills to perform component-level hardware repair in a manner that exceeds the customer’s expectations. If this describes you then this is an excellent opportunity for you to become part of a dedicated team of professionals. Our technicians typically perform service calls throughout the day during normal business hours Monday through Friday. Our field techs work directly with the customers to schedule the service calls which allows for a great deal of flexibility. If you want to be part of this experience then apply today. Computer Technicians should have the following: -Knowledge of and experience in desktop/laptop -Dependable transportation and car insurance -A cell phone -Ability to travel to customer sites -Ability to lift and/or move various computer equipment -Excellent customer service skills -Must to able to work independently -Most have organizational skills -The ability to pass criminal background and driving investigation -The ability to pass a drug screen Incentives to work for Realm Technologies include: -Work from home to schedule your service calls -Professional, friendly, supportive, compassionate management -Dell, IBM, Lenovo, Sony TV, and Dell Printer training and certifications provided free of charge. Job Type: Full-time Salary: $15.00 to $21.00 /hour Job Type: Full-time Pay: $15.00 - $21.00 per hour
html_job_description:
Job Description

Our computer technicians play a vital role in providing superior hardware focused field service support to both residential and commercial customers of major PC and printer manufacturers. The best field technicians are independent self-starters who have the drive, technical aptitude, and interpersonal skills to perform component-level hardware repair in a manner that exceeds the customer’s expectations. If this describes you then this is an excellent opportunity for you to become part of a dedicated team of professionals. Our technicians typically perform service calls throughout the day during normal business hours Monday through Friday. Our field techs work directly with the customers to schedule the service calls which allows for a great deal of flexibility. If you want to be part of this experience then apply today.

Computer Technicians should have the following:

-Knowledge of and experience in desktop/laptop

-Dependable transportation and car insurance

-A cell phone

-Ability to travel to customer sites

-Ability to lift and/or move various computer equipment

-Excellent customer service skills

-Must to able to work independently

-Most have organizational skills

-The ability to pass criminal background and driving investigation

-The ability to pass a drug screen

Incentives to work for Realm Technologies include:

-Work from home to schedule your service calls

-Professional, friendly, supportive, compassionate management

-Dell, IBM, Lenovo, Sony TV, and Dell Printer training and certifications provided free of charge.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $15.00 to $21.00 /hour

job_title: Entry Level Business Development Trainee – Traveling
job_description: 3.2| ||Full-time|18 hours ago| Full Job Description Reynolds and Reynolds is seeking motivated and hard-working Entry Level Business Development Trainees to join our growing team. As an Entry Level Business Development Trainee, you will enroll in our 12 month training program. This program is comprised of both field based and classroom style training. The classroom training is located at our award winning Reynolds University in Dayton, OH. Every month you will travel to Dayton for 1-2 weeks of courses covering a variety of topics, including dealership operations, sales techniques, and negotiation skills. When you are not in Dayton, you will be working with your assigned Sales Mentor in the field, observing the sales process and assisting them on their calls. You will also be given the opportunity to travel with our customer service and installation teams to enhance your knowledge of our products. During the 12 months of training, you can expect to travel up to 75% of the time. Once you complete the training program, you will relocate to your assigned territory and become a Sales Professional. Relocation assistance to this new territory will be provided by the company. In this role you will be responsible for achieving designated monthly and annual quotas by selling Reynolds software products and services to new and existing customers. As a Sales Professional (and Trainee) you will have a home office and will be provided a company car, laptop, iPhone, and other office equipment. Requirements: Ability to build strong customer relationships Bachelor’s degree Excellent oral and written communication skills Must be a self-starter with good time management skills Willing to relocate after successful completion of the 12 month training program

N-Hance Sussex is a busy kitchen remodeling company looking for someone to answer phones, contact customers for follow up and schedule appointments and work. We are located in Sussex County but the job can be performed 100% remotely with Verizon services and a computer. Job entails answering incoming phone calls and handling client questions. Receiving and responding to incoming leads via email, phone or text. Setting appointments for estimates and scheduling work to be performed. This job reports directly to the owners of the company. A daily/weekly recap of work performed is expected. We use a dedicated Customer Database program that allows for simple access to client information, notes, scheduling, email templates, etc. We will provide instruction/training for the program and it does not require any special computer skills beyond normal. If you can find and answer this post, you can work this program! Hours can be very flexible as long as the phone is answered when it rings and the daily tasks are completed when requested. job_title: Professional Business Writing Freelancer Needed - URGENT
job_description: We need a business writer urgently with a vast experience in business writing for startup. We can provide a stream of assignments to the right freelancer. The freelancer must have a top notch professional grade English. Your writing style is concise corporate American style (no verbiage). Your sentences are spelling error free and grammatically correct. You must have the ability to understand a business beyond its provided description in order to write content more extensively. You will do research if needed. Turnaround time: less 24h for small assignments. Please reply with your resume and explain why you are suited as a business writer freelancer. We pay $35 per 500 words. Please submit three samples. This is very important for us to move your application forward. Job Type: Part-time Salary: $8.00 - $52.00 per hour Work Location: Fully Remote Work Remotely: Yes

job_title: Staff Security Researcher, Phishing and Content Protection
job_description: 4.1| || Quick Apply |Full-time|14 hours ago| Full Job Description We are open to candidates across North America to work remotely. Lookout is a cybersecurity company that makes it possible for individuals and enterprises to be both mobile and secure. With 100 million mobile sensors fueling a dataset of virtually all the mobile code in the world, the Lookout Security Cloud can identify connections that would otherwise go unseen - predicting and stopping mobile attacks before they do harm. The world's leading mobile network operators, including AT&T, Deutsche Telekom, EE, KDDI, Orange, Sprint, T-Mobile and Telstra, have selected Lookout as its preferred mobile security solution. Lookout is also partnered with such enterprise leaders as AirWatch, Ingram Micro and MobileIron. Headquartered in San Francisco, Lookout has offices in Amsterdam, Boston, London, Sydney, Tokyo, Toronto and Washington, D.C. To learn more, visit www.lookout.com With a massive mobile security dataset and over 100 granted patents, Lookout's security platform, the Lookout Security Cloud, supports a wide range of Lookout products and services and forms the backbone of Lookout's value and competitive advantages in the mobile security market. We are looking for a Security Researcher to join our Application Security Intelligence team, a group of world-class mobile researchers who work on malware and other app-based threats in the mobile space. As a member of this team you will have access and contribute to an extensive arsenal of detection tools and technologies used to hunt and neutralize Android and iOS malware to protect our users. Responsibilities: Identify and stop threats to user security and privacy, using the largest data set of mobile apps in the world. Hunt down and neutralize malware before it affects our users. Identify and track malicious actors. Create detection logic to protect users from current and future malware instances. Develop tools to mine our mobile app data set to identify new malware families, actors, and trends in mobile malware. Qualifications & skills: Experience in reverse engineering software (mobile App reversing preferred). Ability to read code in Java, C, C++, ARM Assembly; bonus points for ObjectiveC, Swift. Ability to create research tools in Python, Ruby, or Java. Knowledge of mobile systems (Android, iOS). Experience using some of the following tools: IDA Pro, Hopper, gdb, Frida. Curiosity and a strong drive to understand how malware and cyber crime business models work. | Quick Apply

We are a very fast growing cyber security based in Maitland, Fl and 2021 is going to be another busy year for us and we need to add to our team.

We need people to help organize events, design brochures, videos, social media etc.
About this Job

ThreatLocker is looking for a Junior Marketing Coordinator to join the team.We are looking for someone who...

  • Has a high "figure it out" attitude.
  • Has excellent organization skills
  • Can manage multiple projects and keep track of deadlines
  • Is curious and eager to learn
  • Has the ability to work in a remote environment with provided work equipment
  • Is dependable, detail-oriented, and a great communicator
  • Is creative with excellent copywriting skills
  • Graduated with a degree in Marketing/Business, Advertising/PR, Graphic Design, or IT

We are a fast-growing cybersecurity company in the endpoint security space. This person should be able to work under pressure and will be helping out with event planning/deliverables, content marketing, social media, and more.Here are some tools the position will be working with:

  • Google Analytics (certified or willing to obtain certifications)
  • Hubspot (certified or willing to obtain certifications)
  • Adobe Creative Suite
  • Canva
  • Wave
  • Excel/G-Suite (Google sheets, docs, slides, etc.

Benefits - A career with Threatlocker provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package.

This is an excellent opportunity for candidates who are willing to work hard, show up on time for calls

50% Paid Health / Dental / Vision - 30 day wait period

Job Type: Full-time

PTO

Flexible Work Schedule

Training Program with Udemy

Base salary $35,000,and quarterly bonus if the company's sales targets are met. Opportunity to get promoted within the company.

Threatlocker is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Threatlocker does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, state or local laws.

If you think this high paced environment suits your personality, please apply.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $35,000.00 - $40,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

  • Bonus pay

COVID-19 considerations:
Remote from home due to Covid restrictions

Work Location:

  • One location
  • On the road

This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:

  • Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous
  • People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects
  • Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture
  • Achievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail
  • Autonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little direction
  • High stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environment

Company's website:

  • www.threatlocker.com

Benefit Conditions:

  • Waiting period may apply
  • Only full-time employees eligible

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

  • Remote interview process

job_description: 4.3| ||Full-time|2 hours ago| Full Job Description We are a family residing in Endwell, NY looking for full-time weekday care for our two toddlers (3-yr-old boy and 1-yr-old girl). Both mom and dad work remotely from home and are available to assist in most circumstances, but will otherwise be upstairs leaving the nanny and kids space to play freely and be entertained. Light housework would also be appreciated as children currently nap ~2 hours in the afternoon, which may include loading the dishwasher, wiping down counters and possibly folding laundry. CPR and First Aid training preferred.

job_title: Entry Level Business Development Trainee – Traveling
job_description: 3.2| ||Full-time|23 hours ago| Full Job Description Reynolds and Reynolds is seeking motivated and hard-working Entry Level Business Development Trainees to join our growing team. As an Entry Level Business Development Trainee, you will enroll in our 12 month training program. This program is comprised of both field based and classroom style training. The classroom training is located at our award winning Reynolds University in Dayton, OH. Every month you will travel to Dayton for 1-2 weeks of courses covering a variety of topics, including dealership operations, sales techniques, and negotiation skills. When you are not in Dayton, you will be working with your assigned Sales Mentor in the field, observing the sales process and assisting them on their calls. You will also be given the opportunity to travel with our customer service and installation teams to enhance your knowledge of our products. During the 12 months of training, you can expect to travel up to 75% of the time. Once you complete the training program, you will relocate to your assigned territory and become a Sales Professional. Relocation assistance to this new territory will be provided by the company. In this role you will be responsible for achieving designated monthly and annual quotas by selling Reynolds software products and services to new and existing customers. As a Sales Professional (and Trainee) you will have a home office and will be provided a company car, laptop, iPhone, and other office equipment. Requirements: Ability to build strong customer relationships Bachelor’s degree Excellent oral and written communication skills Must be a self-starter with good time management skills Willing to relocate after successful completion of the 12 month training program

job_description: 3.8| || Quick Apply |Full-time|16 hours ago| Full Job Description As a Customer Experience Representative you will have constant interaction with clients, store employees and the home office. The ideal candidate will be attentive to details with an eye for aesthetics and excellent communication skills. If you are willing to go above and beyond to serve the needs of our clients this position may be for you. The Customer Experience Representative (CER) plays a key role at the store in exceeding our clients expectations on every visit. The CER greets clients, handles incoming phone calls, performs ring cleanings and inspections, handles payments and point of sale transactions, and makes each client feel special and welcome on every visit. The CER may even be called upon to help a plan a surprise Perfect Proposal for a client. Additionally the CER will be responsible for the operational functions of the store. They order and stock supplies, perform all inventory control functions, conduct audits, ship and receive merchandise, conduct quality control inspections, and assist clients in making purchases as needed. The CER provides superior customer service. Strong communication skills and a professional presence are a must. Cashier or Customer Service experience preferred. Candidates must be able to work a flexible retail schedule that includes both day and evening shifts as well as both Saturday and Sunday. Brand: Robbins Brothers Address: 7717 Friars Rd San Diego, CA - 92108 Property Description: 0055-San Diego, CA Property Number: 0055 | Quick Apply

3.6| ||Full-time|1 hour ago| Full Job Description Job Description: BCBA: Clinic & Home Based Services Location: Oswego, IL Full Time (40 hrs) Benefits Eligible QUALIFICATIONS: BCBA certification At least 1+ year(s) experience working as a BCBA with children with autism in the field of ABA. Excellent written and verbal skills. Ability to drive to meetings and service sites. RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE: Case Supervision Manage a caseload of clients receiving behavior analytic service. Create and maintain current client programming, including data analysis, assessment and programmatic changes. Follow guidelines for new programming implementation (material creation and staff training) and BPI Programming Guide. Conduct initial assessments for new clients. Complete paperwork necessary for insurance authorizations for new and ongoing services Cover direct 1:1 sessions as needed per the established coverage hierarchy Promote professional relationships between staff and parents. Communicate with parents and caregivers regarding progress and specific interventions Provide training to parents and caregivers on client specific goals regularly. Provide coordination of care with schools and other professionals on client specific matters. Generate regular summary reports and goals. RBT Supervision: Supervise a caseload of Behavior Technicians providing in home and clinic based ABA treatment to children with autism. Conduct appropriate supervision based on BACB guidelines, collecting and maintaining records on the company Drive for all supervisees (i.e. supervision notes and competencies) Train and supervise new and veteran staff. Provide feedback and complete competencies verbally and on paper, providing a copy to the technician following observation/training and storing in the folder (currently on the Drive) per month and year. Conduct team meetings with staff, clients and their families as needed. Regular training of Clinic Managers on your client s programming (i.e. including on CR message updates and in person training) Administrative: Adhere to current billable hours, parent training and supervision requirements. Respond to correspondence in BPI provided phone, gmail and Central Reach messaging within 24 business hours. Travel between clinic(s) and client home locations as needed. Participate in development, PR, and marketing for program expansion of Behavioral Perspective as assigned. Attend & participate in company sponsored continuing education. Attend and participate in BCBA meetings including cross training peers as assigned. Assist in the creation and delivery of live and web-based trainings as assigned. Attend and participate in regular case consultations with Program Coordinator. Work a minimum of 40 hours a week, including direct supervision and indirect tasks. Behavioral Perspective Inc. provides equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons, and does not unlawfully discriminate against any person on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. All career opportunities at www.BPIABA.com EOE EEO Job Type: Full-time

Full-time|21 hours ago| Full Job Description WHAT WE NEED Detail-oriented, data specialists who can work from home/remote within Indiana or Illinois. WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR Good learners. Strong supporters. Accurate reviewers. Our medical coders are an important part of the medical record team. Ensuring diagnoses and procedures are accurately recorded is a big part of the job. The other part? Being able to follow state and federal compliance regulations. It’s no small task. Think you’re up for the job? Are you timely and accurate? Are you detail-oriented? Do you love knowing that you’re an integral part of the team? We’ve got a great place to put your skills to work. WHAT YOU WILL DO Accurately review and code patient records in the following clinical areas: Acute - Outpatient, Acute - All Inpatient Service Lines, and Ambulatory Level 3 Specialty Services, as reflected in the Franciscan Coding Tier Matrix. Meet defined coding accuracy and production standards and demonstrate a thorough knowledge of coding guidelines, medical terminology, anatomy/physiology, reimbursement schemes, and Payor specific guidelines. Review and analyze the content of medical records to appropriately assign ICD diagnosis procedure codes, CPT procedure codes, and modifiers to meet coding guidelines. Notify coding leadership of trends and topics for education and feedback to physicians and departments. Identify and enter data elements for abstracting. Participate actively in performance improvement teams, projects, and committees. Serve as a Superuser and assist with system testing. Serve as a backup to coding reimbursement specialist. WHAT IT TAKES TO SUCCEED CCS, CPC, CCS-P, CCA with Coding experience, if not RHIT or RHIA Certified. Knowledge of types of health information and the rules and regulations surrounding their use. Advanced understanding of coding grouping methodologies. Understanding of payer relationships, requirements and compliant billing practices and understanding of common medical terminology, anatomy and physiology. Knowledge of pharmaceutical terminology, generic and trade names, and ICD coding and terminology used in diagnosis and classification of illnesses, injuries, and disabilities. Concentrate for long periods. Follow directions as communicated in a variety of ways. Work independently with minimal supervision. Critically evaluate and analyze information in written materials. Process Improvement. Accept personal accountability for deliverables and actions. Effective communicator in multiple forms. Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications.
