html_job_description:
*Job Description
*
We are looking for a PHP Developer responsible for managing back-end services and the interchange of data between the server and the database. Your primary focus will be the development of server-side logic however, at times will require work on the front-end as well.

*Responsibilities
*

  • Build efficient, testable, and reusable PHP modules
  • Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges
  • Integration of data storage solutions

*Skills And Qualifications
*

  • Strong knowledge of Yii PHP web frameworks
  • Strong knowledge of the Laravel PHP framework
  • Understanding the fully synchronous behavior of PHP
  • Understanding design patterns
  • Basic understanding of front-end technologies, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3
  • Knowledge of object-oriented PHP programming
  • Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
  • User authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environments
  • Integration of multiple data sources and databases into one system
  • Familiarity with limitations of PHP as a platform and its workarounds
  • Familiarity with NoSQL (MongoDb) databases and their declarative query languages
  • Familiarity with Microservices architecture.
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $92,000.00 per year

Benefits:

Transportation Dispatch Assistant

Department: Logistics

Status: Exempt

Summary:

Assist our dispatch department with daily tasks to ensure total customer satisfaction

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

  • Create orders in the dispatch WMS
  • Schedule and coordinate outbound truckloads with the warehouse
  • Contact carriers for truck availability and schedule delivery appointments at consignee
  • Enter freight costs; assist with freight bill invoicing discrepancies
  • Rate out shipments utilizing all modes of transportation
  • Monitor and assist in late shift responsibilities, ensuring all loads are picked up and/or accounted for.
  • Update all necessary Jerich files on a daily basis

Competency:

To perform this job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

Good interpersonal and communication skills in dealing with vendors, employees, and management.

  • Meet deadlines and perform accurate work with minimal supervision.
  • Must be able to multitask and execute assignments in a timely manner.
  • Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
  • Respond to requests for service and assistance; meet commitments.
  • Look for ways to improve and promote quality; demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness.

  • Bachelors Degree in Business or Logistics

  • 4Warder

job_description: You might be a good fit for this Full Charge Bookkeeper opportunity with growth potential, if you multi-task effectively and have strong communication, organizational, and time-management skills. Accountemps is hiring 2 Full Charge Bookkeepers, and you might be the perfect candidate if you have experience working in multiple sets of books and experience working with HOA's. Experience in TOPS software is highly desired, or MRI or Yardi. The short-term temporary-to-full-time Full Charge Bookkeepers will work remotely to start and when the office opens, then in Clearwater, Florida. The role will be responsible for all general accounting and bookkeeping functions including the preparation of financial statements for multiple HOA's and their sets of books. You will also be establishing and maintaining the organization's accounting principles, practices, procedures, and initiatives. Key responsibilities - Maintaining adherence to federal, state, and local legal requirements by keeping up to date on them, filing reports, and advising management on needed actions - Handling bank and general ledger reconciliations, as well as payroll processing - Processing accounts payable and accounts receivable; handling collections as needed - Ensuring monthly, quarterly and year end close happens accurately and on time - Carefully filing documents to preserve historical records - Preparing the trial balance and financial statements, including, but not limited to, balance sheet, income statement, and statement of cash flows - Overseeing accounting clerks and entry-level bookkeepers - Following progress of fixed assets to prepare depreciation schedules

If you’re both an animal lover and a people person, a position in one of our stores might be a great fit. We’re looking for people with a strong commitment to helping pets and their parents experience their very best lives together. When you join us, you’ll be part of a great team, working together to achieve sales goals while doing work you truly love. Position Purpose: Responsible for the efficient execution of merchandising items to ensure with consistency in product sets and signage displays across a group of stores. Accountable for a reduction in time spent on merchandising processes due to an increased familiarity of sets. Essential Job Functions:   Through previous background and experience the candidate must demonstrate, with or without an accommodation, the ability to... Interact professionally and effectively through verbal and written communication with all professional contacts with emphasis on company interests Good knowledge of the store product and strong merchandising and organization skills. Ability to be diligent in completion of time keeping, mileage calculations and expenses. Access to reliable transportation, proper liability insurance Move merchandise up to 50 pounds Supervisory Responsibility   None   Work Environment   The nature of the job requires daily travel to various stores, with overnight stay possible for remote locations.  Duties may include bending, stooping, lifting (50 lbs), standing, walking and fixture building.  Associate may be expected to occasionally use a hand-held tool such as a hammer or rubber mallet to perform a task.
html_job_description:
If you’re both an animal lover and a people person, a position in one of our stores might be a great fit. We’re looking for people with a strong commitment to helping pets and their parents experience their very best lives together. When you join us, you’ll be part of a great team, working together to achieve sales goals while doing work you truly love.

Position Purpose:


Responsible for the efficient execution of merchandising items to ensure with consistency in product sets and signage displays across a group of stores. Accountable for a reduction in time spent on merchandising processes due to an increased familiarity of sets.


Essential Job Functions:

 
Through previous background and experience the candidate must demonstrate, with or without an accommodation, the ability to...
  • Interact professionally and effectively through verbal and written communication with all professional contacts with emphasis on company interests
  • Good knowledge of the store product and strong merchandising and organization skills.
  • Ability to be diligent in completion of time keeping, mileage calculations and expenses.
  • Access to reliable transportation, proper liability insurance
  • Move merchandise up to 50 pounds

Supervisory Responsibility

 
None

 

Work Environment

 
The nature of the job requires daily travel to various stores, with overnight stay possible for remote locations.  Duties may include bending, stooping, lifting (50 lbs), standing, walking and fixture building.  Associate may be expected to occasionally use a hand-held tool such as a hammer or rubber mallet to perform a task.

html_job_description:
If you’re both an animal lover and a people person, a position in one of our stores might be a great fit. We’re looking for people with a strong commitment to helping pets and their parents experience their very best lives together. When you join us, you’ll be part of a great team, working together to achieve sales goals while doing work you truly love.

Position Purpose:


Responsible for the efficient execution of merchandising items to ensure with consistency in product sets and signage displays across a group of stores. Accountable for a reduction in time spent on merchandising processes due to an increased familiarity of sets.


Essential Job Functions:

 
Through previous background and experience the candidate must demonstrate, with or without an accommodation, the ability to...
  • Interact professionally and effectively through verbal and written communication with all professional contacts with emphasis on company interests
  • Good knowledge of the store product and strong merchandising and organization skills.
  • Ability to be diligent in completion of time keeping, mileage calculations and expenses.
  • Access to reliable transportation, proper liability insurance
  • Move merchandise up to 50 pounds

Supervisory Responsibility

 
None

 

Work Environment

 
The nature of the job requires daily travel to various stores, with overnight stay possible for remote locations.  Duties may include bending, stooping, lifting (50 lbs), standing, walking and fixture building.  Associate may be expected to occasionally use a hand-held tool such as a hammer or rubber mallet to perform a task.

job_description: Part-time|13 hours ago| Full Job Description RJI Communications Specialist Job Open Date: December 16 Job Close Date: Open until filled Position Type: Part-Time Salary Range: $13,000-$20,000 (salary commensurate with experience and determined number of hours) Overview of Position The part-time Communications Specialist will assist in growing a national movement to prevent human trafficking by coordinating and optimizing RJI’s internal and external communications. The ideal candidate has a great eye for detail, experience managing and creating on target branded content, and is passionate about utilizing communications to help an organization thrive. This role engages audiences through managing RJI’s brand, social media channels, websites, and other communication tools. Working closely with churches, prayer partners, and the RJI team is also a critical component of this job and requires a mature Christian faith, understanding and personal application of Biblical Scripture. The RJI headquarters is located in the Richmond, VA area. This position has the opportunity to be filled locally or from a U.S.-based remote location, reports directly to the CEO and works closely with all RJI staff. As RJI is a rapidly growing non-profit with in-demand programs, this position has a high potential for growth. Key Responsibilities: Internal and External Communications Coordinate with CEO to develop RJI’s brand and communication strategy to support RJI’s mission and vision, including creating yearly communications plans. Optimize communication platforms to increase programmatic and fundraising engagement to support our mission and organizational goals. Manage RJI’s communication tools including social media, websites, monthly updates and prayer newsletters, graphic design, etc. Create resources for various audiences, including leading our Christian partners to join the RJI team through prayer for human trafficking. Recruit, train, and oversee communications volunteer team members. Coordinate with the media and other partners to promote RJI’s mission, initiatives, programs, and news. Oversee communications with our Benefit for Freedom and other fundraising events. Represent RJI at occasional events and media opportunities Brand Development Assist in RJI’s branding development and strategy, based on the organization’s priorities and needs. Create content and manage brand collateral: including print and online, merchandise, promotional videos, etc. Grow RJI’s online presence including SEO. Develop on-target branded content that increases brand recognition and engagement. Graphic and Written Content Develop engaging, professional, brand-appropriate graphic and written content Manage communication projects including video, photography, graphic design, and written communication for educational and promotional needs. Collect quotes, stories, and data to create engaging content Develop organization’s user experience and pipeline to best reach and serve target audiences Create marketing strategy and materials for initiatives and programs. Other tasks as needed Requirements: Skills and Experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including a firm grasp of grammar/spelling Ability to communicate and engage well with different sets of audiences through various platforms Mastery in creating brand-appropriate, engaging, accurate communications and graphics Solid knowledge of social media platforms and engagement growth strategies Working knowledge of WordPress, Mailchimp, Microsoft Office, CRM (currently using Little Green Light), and graphic design software (examples: Photoshop, Canva, etc.). Preferred knowledge of optimizing digital marketing including SEO, pipelining, etc. Adeptness in managing projects from successful beginning to completion Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, be flexible, and manage tasks in a fast-paced work environment Personal understanding and experience in applying Biblical aspects of prayer, God’s heart for justice and the practical application for people of Christian faith and the church Critical Qualities Mature Christian Faith Professional: represent the org well to partners, clients, team members Responsible: reliable, committed to finding good solutions Pursues excellence Detail-oriented Organized Creative Coachable: a willingness to learn and receive instruction with humility Team Player: works well with others, willingness to do what is needed Self-motivating Goal-achieving Innovative problem solver Ability to build trust and strong partnerships Culturally sensitive and appreciative of differences Resilient in dealing with the difficult subject matter of human trafficking

2.6| ||Full-time|3 hours ago| Full Job Description Join one of Pennsylvania’s fastest growing companies today! WebstaurantStore, a Clark Associates company, is looking for proactive, detail oriented candidates to join our growing company as a Stock Order Coordinator within our Logistics department. Submit your resume and apply online today.

2.9| || Quick Apply |Full-time|2 hours ago| Full Job Description We are currently looking for an Audience Development Coordinator to join our Publishing Operations team. The Audience Development Coordinator will be responsible for helping employ engagement strategy across our verticals and will be constantly thinking about how to get people talking, how to make content go viral, how to create images that are highly shareable and spark conversation. The Audience Development Coordinator will also be paying attention to what's trending online and helping to the team develop engagement strategies focused on these specific topics in real time. This is definitely not your everyday social media position. This is a hands-on, in the trenches role. It’s Facebook-focused and data-driven, and you’ll learn a lot about how to manage a community of nearly 40 million social followers across our brands. Because we’re so data-oriented, our strategies tend to be on the industry’s bleeding edge. We have several powerful tools and systems that make the social process way more efficient, scalable, and iterative. Some examples of the Social Media verticals we create are Weird History, Total Nerd and Graveyard Shift. Who we believe will do great in this role: Our successful hires hit the ground running, can adapt to change quickly, and advocate for new strategies that actually move the bar. You also need to be extremely well-versed in pop / internet-culture, and mega bonus points if you have a witty/smart sense of humor. What you’ll need: Social media experience is preferred, but applicants looking to break into the field will be considered A basic understanding of Photoshop and other design tools A deep understand and passion for pop culture, and all things ‘internet’ and ‘social’ You are an active participant across all social media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, Pinterest, and Reddit. You know how to engage an audience. Do you have your own web series or blog? We like that. Do you have a ton of Twitter followers? We like that too (but it's not necessary!) You have viral intuition. Do you ever see something on Reddit and think, “Hmm. That looks like something else I’ve seen before.” Great impulse. We do that hourly. What’s in it for you: Fully-paid medical, plus voluntary dental and vision plans. Paid holidays, plus additional days of paid time off per year. Work from home (for the time being due to COVID) A fun, collaborative work environment | Quick Apply

2.6| ||Full-time|3 hours ago| Full Job Description The WebstaurantStore is the leading ecommerce website to meet the purchasing needs of the food service professional worldwide. WebstaurantStore, a Clark Associates company, is looking for proactive, detail oriented candidates to join our growing company as a Stock Order Coordinator within our Logistics department. This role focuses on problem solving and process improvement to keep orders flowing through our systems. This part of the supply chain is a key component of growing our business and serving the purchasing needs of foodservice professionals worldwide. As a Stock Order Coordinator you will: Make and execute decisions regarding the best way to fulfill orders Collaborate with others in Logistics to ensure fast processing of orders Communicate with internal and external sources to ensure effective order fulfilment specifically with our distribution centers and purchasing department Evaluate current processes and suggest any appropriate improvements to increase efficiency and better the customer experience Provide friendly & empathetic communication, primarily through email, to customers on status of orders and assist in problem solving to satisfy their order requirements Investigate processing as well as customer problems and provide strategic solutions Gain an understanding and help to improve automated order routing logic Develop methods and reports to analyze business outcomes We are looking for driven, motivated candidates who are: Detail oriented Adept at communicating effectively to a variety of audiences Able to prioritize and balance multiple responsibilities Willing to take initiative and ownership of problems to find solutions Able to balance desired business and customer outcomes A team player who wants to contribute to a thriving culture Able to flourish in a fast-paced, changing environment Computer literate Have a college degree We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, wellness programs, gym membership reimbursement, paid maternity leave, work from home opportunities, and a 401k with company match. Employees also enjoy regular food service industry training from top manufacturers and product experts. If you’re ready for a challenge, and have the ambition to succeed in a fast paced, growing industry, we’d love to discuss the Stock Order Coordinator position with you! Submit your resume and apply online today.

job_description: 3.5| ||Full-time|3 hours ago| Full Job Description Company Description RockCreek is a leading global investment management firm that applies data-driven technology and innovation to sustainable investing. RockCreek’s entrepreneurial spirit, open culture, and inclusive team lead to better investments for universities, foundations, pension plans, and sovereign funds that partner with us. The firm is highly focused on the integration of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors as well as diversity and sustainable impact across portfolios to generate long-term returns. RockCreek has a culture of diversity, debate, and relentless drive to excel. RockCreek is among the largest inclusive firms in the world. Since our founding, RockCreek’s commitment to sustainable investing, long term value creation, and good governance has begun at home. The way we operate our offices and partner with multiple stakeholders are in keeping with our aim to have a positive impact on markets globally and reduce our carbon footprint. Our founders have a deep commitment to sustainability as well as extensive experience with sustainable impact investing and ESG policies which date back to the 1980s including investing in energy, health, education, fintek, and financial inclusion. Job Description RockCreek seeks a dynamic, resourceful, energetic, and detail-oriented Associate for the Office of the CEO. The primary responsibility will be to support the firm’s CEO in management, business development and client services efforts, including providing administration and scheduling, coordinating travel, conducting research, writing and editing reports and correspondence, planning events, and handling external communication. The ideal candidate is highly organized, flexible, able to anticipate change, passionate and up to date on current financial markets and sustainability. The candidate should be able to thrive in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a high level of professionalism and confidentiality. The candidate must be a team player who takes initiative, anticipates needs, and adapts to demanding and ever-changing situations. The Associate would have opportunities to attend certain meetings or events with the CEO. Qualifications Strong academic background (or equivalent) Experience in sustainable investing, communications, and administration in the technology industry, finance experience is preferred Understanding of global financial markets, economic news, and business through study and work An interest in economics, finance, data science, and impact is preferred Experience working in a fast-paced, team-oriented culture with an ability to take charge and manage projects under time deadlines and flexible hours while taking ownership Excellent verbal and written communication skills A highly-organized problem solver willing to meet tight deadlines Proficient to advanced skills with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Office365) and WordPress, additional visualization software skills are a plus Additional Information Benefits Consistent with our belief that team members are our most valuable asset, RockCreek offers a competitive benefits package. Ability to work remotely with support technology Medical, dental, and vision insurance; dependents eligible 401(k) retirement plan with company match Paid time off, sick leave, and company holidays Wellness programs including meditation and fitness classes Onsite gym Additional Information For additional information on RockCreek, please visit https://therockcreekgroup.com Follow us on LinkedIn: https://linkedin.com/compnay/the-rock-creek-group

4.3| ||Part-time|1 day ago| Full Job Description Our son is due to be born at the end of January. We are a multilingual household, speaking both English and Gujarati, and are looking for a babysitter that can speak Hindi fluently to expose our child to Hindi before he’s old enough to take classes. My husband and I both work from home. We will only be needing care once my maternity leave ends in March and will only need care occasionally- that may be while we attend virtual meetings on weekdays or even have a date night every once in awhile. I need someone that has a lot of confidence and experience with infants. I prefer someone with infant cpr/first aid training.

We are looking for a part time bookkeeper to help our growing moving company track finances and handle accounts payable and receivable. This position is mostly remote or work from home, however the applicant should be available to stop by the office regularly to make deposits and pick up receipts. Responsibilities include: Consolidate and organize weekly receipts Classify expenses and revenues in Quickbooks Process weekly and bi-weekly payroll Manage accounts payable Collect accounts receivable Produce regular P&L and balance sheet reports Produce expense ratio reports Identify cost saving measures Applicants must: Be proficient in Quickbooks Online Have book keeping experience Have a flawless background Have a bachelor's degree in business, mathematics, accounting or finance Be organized with an affinity for numbers Job Type: Part-time Pay: $20.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Experience: QuickBooks: 1 year (Preferred) Bookkeeping: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: Fully Remote This Job Is: A job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to apply A job for which people with disabilities are encouraged to apply Company's website: www.2collegebrothers.com Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/2-College-Brothers-Moving-and-Storage-of-Tampa Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19 COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process Social distancing guidelines in place Virtual meetings

The goal of the position is to enhance the synchronous experiences for students on days when they are learning remotely. RJI Communications Specialist Job Open Date: December 16 Job Close Date: Open until filled Position Type: Part-Time Salary Range: $13,000-$20,000 (salary commensurate with experience and determined number of hours) Overview of Position The part-time Communications Specialist will assist in growing a national movement to prevent human trafficking by coordinating and optimizing RJI’s internal and external communications. The ideal candidate has a great eye for detail, experience managing and creating on target branded content, and is passionate about utilizing communications to help an organization thrive. This role engages audiences through managing RJI’s brand, social media channels, websites, and other communication tools. Working closely with churches, prayer partners, and the RJI team is also a critical component of this job and requires a mature Christian faith, understanding and personal application of Biblical Scripture. The RJI headquarters is located in the Richmond, VA area. This position has the opportunity to be filled locally or from a U.S.-based remote location, reports directly to the CEO and works closely with all RJI staff. As RJI is a rapidly growing non-profit with in-demand programs, this position has a high potential for growth. Key Responsibilities: Internal and External Communications Coordinate with CEO to develop RJI’s brand and communication strategy to support RJI’s mission and vision, including creating yearly communications plans. Optimize communication platforms to increase programmatic and fundraising engagement to support our mission and organizational goals. Manage RJI’s communication tools including social media, websites, monthly updates and prayer newsletters, graphic design, etc. Create resources for various audiences, including leading our Christian partners to join the RJI team through prayer for human trafficking. Recruit, train, and oversee communications volunteer team members. Coordinate with the media and other partners to promote RJI’s mission, initiatives, programs, and news. Oversee communications with our Benefit for Freedom and other fundraising events. Represent RJI at occasional events and media opportunities Brand Development Assist in RJI’s branding development and strategy, based on the organization’s priorities and needs. Create content and manage brand collateral: including print and online, merchandise, promotional videos, etc. Grow RJI’s online presence including SEO. Develop on-target branded content that increases brand recognition and engagement. Graphic and Written Content Develop engaging, professional, brand-appropriate graphic and written content Manage communication projects including video, photography, graphic design, and written communication for educational and promotional needs. Collect quotes, stories, and data to create engaging content Develop organization’s user experience and pipeline to best reach and serve target audiences Create marketing strategy and materials for initiatives and programs. Other tasks as needed Requirements: Skills and Experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including a firm grasp of grammar/spelling Ability to communicate and engage well with different sets of audiences through various platforms Mastery in creating brand-appropriate, engaging, accurate communications and graphics Solid knowledge of social media platforms and engagement growth strategies Working knowledge of WordPress, Mailchimp, Microsoft Office, CRM (currently using Little Green Light), and graphic design software (examples: Photoshop, Canva, etc.). html_job_description:
RJI Communications Specialist

Job Open Date: December 16
Job Close Date: Open until filled
Position Type: Part-Time
Salary Range: $13,000-$20,000 (salary commensurate with experience and determined number of hours)

Overview of Position

The part-time Communications Specialist will assist in growing a national movement to prevent human trafficking by coordinating and optimizing RJI’s internal and external communications. The ideal candidate has a great eye for detail, experience managing and creating on target branded content, and is passionate about utilizing communications to help an organization thrive. This role engages audiences through managing RJI’s brand, social media channels, websites, and other communication tools. Working closely with churches, prayer partners, and the RJI team is also a critical component of this job and requires a mature Christian faith, understanding and personal application of Biblical Scripture. The RJI headquarters is located in the Richmond, VA area. This position has the opportunity to be filled locally or from a U.S.-based remote location, reports directly to the CEO and works closely with all RJI staff. As RJI is a rapidly growing non-profit with in-demand programs, this position has a high potential for growth.

Key Responsibilities:

Internal and External Communications

  • Coordinate with CEO to develop RJI’s brand and communication strategy to support RJI’s mission and vision, including creating yearly communications plans.
  • Optimize communication platforms to increase programmatic and fundraising engagement to support our mission and organizational goals.
  • Manage RJI’s communication tools including social media, websites, monthly updates and prayer newsletters, graphic design, etc.
  • Create resources for various audiences, including leading our Christian partners to join the RJI team through prayer for human trafficking.
  • Recruit, train, and oversee communications volunteer team members.
  • Coordinate with the media and other partners to promote RJI’s mission, initiatives, programs, and news.
  • Oversee communications with our Benefit for Freedom and other fundraising events.
  • Represent RJI at occasional events and media opportunities

Brand Development

  • Assist in RJI’s branding development and strategy, based on the organization’s priorities and needs.
  • Create content and manage brand collateral: including print and online, merchandise, promotional videos, etc.
  • Grow RJI’s online presence including SEO.
  • Develop on-target branded content that increases brand recognition and engagement.

Graphic and Written Content

  • Develop engaging, professional, brand-appropriate graphic and written content
  • Manage communication projects including video, photography, graphic design, and written communication for educational and promotional needs.
  • Collect quotes, stories, and data to create engaging content
  • Develop organization’s user experience and pipeline to best reach and serve target audiences
  • Create marketing strategy and materials for initiatives and programs.

Other tasks as needed

Requirements:

Skills and Experience

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including a firm grasp of grammar/spelling
  • Ability to communicate and engage well with different sets of audiences through various platforms
  • Mastery in creating brand-appropriate, engaging, accurate communications and graphics
  • Solid knowledge of social media platforms and engagement growth strategies
  • Working knowledge of WordPress, Mailchimp, Microsoft Office, CRM (currently using Little Green Light), and graphic design software (examples: Photoshop, Canva, etc.).
  • Preferred knowledge of optimizing digital marketing including SEO, pipelining, etc.
  • Adeptness in managing projects from successful beginning to completion
  • Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, be flexible, and manage tasks in a fast-paced work environment
  • Personal understanding and experience in applying Biblical aspects of prayer, God’s heart for justice and the practical application for people of Christian faith and the church

Critical Qualities

  • Mature Christian Faith
  • Professional: represent the org well to partners, clients, team members
  • Responsible: reliable, committed to finding good solutions
  • Pursues excellence
  • Detail-oriented
  • Organized
  • Creative
  • Coachable: a willingness to learn and receive instruction with humility
  • Team Player: works well with others, willingness to do what is needed
  • Self-motivating
  • Goal-achieving
  • Innovative problem solver
  • Ability to build trust and strong partnerships
  • Culturally sensitive and appreciative of differences
  • Resilient in dealing with the difficult subject matter of human trafficking

html_job_description:
We are looking for an experienced Digital Marketing Executive to assist in the planning, execution and optimization of our online marketing efforts. The promotion of products and services through digital channels is a complex procedure with great potential which becomes increasingly useful for companies such as ours. The ideal candidate will have a passion for all things marketing and technology. You will be well-versed in the concepts surrounding digital marketing and how the Internet can become a strong asset to securing growing revenue. You will be tech-savvy and intuitive with great ideas to reinforce our marketing campaign.

Responsibilities

  • Assist in the formulation of strategies to build a lasting digital connection with consumers
  • Plan and monitor the ongoing company presence on social media (LinkedIn, Facebook, etc.)
  • Launch optimized online adverts through Google Adwords, Facebook, etc. to increase company and brand awareness
  • Be actively involved in SEO efforts (keyword, image optimization, etc.)
  • Prepare online newsletters and promotional emails and organize their distribution through various channels
  • Provide creative ideas for content marketing and update website
  • Collaborate with designers to improve user experience
  • Measure the performance of digital marketing efforts using a variety of Web analytics tools (Google Analytics, WebTrends, etc.)
  • Acquire insight into online marketing trends and keep strategies up-to-date
  • Maintain partnerships with media agencies and vendors

Skills

  • Proven experience as a Digital Marketing Executive or similar role
  • Excellent understanding of digital marketing concepts and best practices
  • Experience with B2B and B2C social media, Google Adwords and email campaigns, and SEO/SEM
  • Working knowledge of ad serving tools (e.g., DART, Atlas)
  • Perfect knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics)
  • Skills and experience in creative content writing
  • Analytical mindset and critical thinking
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • BSc/BA in marketing or relevant field

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental insurance
  • Flexible schedule
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

  • Bonus pay

COVID-19 considerations:
You can work from home during this time if desired.

This Job Is:

  • A job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to apply
  • Open to applicants who do not have a college diploma

Company's website:

  • wellgistics.com

Company's Facebook page:

  • https://www.facebook.com/wellgistics

Benefit Conditions:

  • Waiting period may apply

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process
  • Social distancing guidelines in place
  • Virtual meetings
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

job_description: Quick Apply |Contract|3 hours ago| Full Job Description C/C/G is a Social Marketing & Creative Agency working with innovative companies to meet the needs of today’s ever-changing digital world. In a hyper-competitive landscape, every word matters, and our clients depend on us to help choose the words that will cut through the noise and connect with fans & consumers alike. As the lead social storyteller for our CPG brands, you’ll be responsible for helping build that connection. You’ll work alongside the account team to concept and develop the messaging & communication strategy for each campaign, then execute that strategy through a variety of tactics including social posts, paid media, and community engagement. The ideal candidate is someone with a passion for telling stories in the most authentic way possible. They’re active on social media and comfortable talking with friends & strangers alike. They think quickly (but never rush) and always look for the positive side of a conversation. And they’re never at a loss for words. We value autonomy and empowering our team members to grow their skills to meet their personal expectations, push towards goals, and produce great work. This position offers the flexibility to work remotely, allowing you to work wherever you feel the most creative. What You Bring To The Team: Bachelor’s Degree in business, marketing, communications, or related field. Deep & nuanced understanding of current social media platforms and best practices for each. Strong analytical, verbal, and written skills. Ability to work collaboratively and cross-functionally with internal and external teams. Comfortable moving between & balancing multiple projects at a time. Self-starter that’s capable of working autonomously. About C/C/G: C/C/G is a Social Marketing & Creative Agency working with innovative companies to meet the needs of today’s ever changing digital world.We work hard for our clients to amplify sales, delight their customers, and make an impact. | Quick Apply
